Meaning IN CONTEXT: smooth; tender; not harsh; not rough
Meaning in native language: деликатный; тактичный; вежливый; не резкий; не грубый
Example1:
akakkasaṃ viññāpaniṃ, giraṃ saccam'udīraye,
yāya n'ābhisaje kañci, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having no doubt; not uncertain
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akaṅkhī hoti avicikicchī niṭṭhaṅ'gato saddhamme. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: nothing; lit. not something
Example1:
na brāhmaṇass'etad'akiñci seyyo,
yadā nisedho manaso piyehi,
yato yato hiṃsamano nivattati,
tato tato sammati'm'eva dukkhaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unfit to be talked to; should not be spoken to
Meaning in native language: не подходит для разговора (с); не следует говорить (с)
Commentary: (ANa) akaccho'ti kathetuṃ na yutto.
Example1: sac’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen’aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ’ca dosañ’ca appaccayañ’ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not done; not performed; not acted
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā, akaṭa-anudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena, saddhiṃ sambhuñjeyya vā saṃvaseyya vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not performed the legal procedure; who has not been dealt with according to the rule
Meaning in native language: кто не выполнил правовую процедуру; с которым не поступили в соответствии с правилом
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.69) akaṭ'ānudhammo nāma ukkhitto anosārito.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā, akaṭ’ānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena, saddhiṃ sambhuñjeyya vā saṃvaseyya vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not done good deeds
Commentary: (ANa) akatakalyāṇo'tiādīsu kalyāṇaṃ vuccati puññakammaṃ, taṃ akataṃ etenā'ti akatakalyāṇo. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not done wrong; who has not done dirty things; who has not committed sins
Meaning in native language: кто не делал ничего плохого; кто не делал грязных вещей; кто не совершал грехи
Commentary: (ANa) kibbisan'ti samalaṃ aparisuddhakammaṃ
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not done good; who has not made merit
Meaning in native language: кто не делал добро; кто не делал заслуг
Commentary: (ANa) puññakammam'eva hi kosallasambhūtattā kusalaṃ
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: ungrateful; lit. not knowing what is done
Meaning in native language: неблагодарный; досл. не знающий что сделано
Example1:
assaddho akataññū ca, sandhicchedo ca yo naro,
hat'āvakāso vant'āso, sa ve uttamaporiso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: knowing the uncreated; who knows the unborn
Meaning in native language: знающий не сотворенное; кто знает не рожденное
Example1:
chinda sotaṃ parakkamma, kāme panūda brāhmaṇa,
saṅkhārānaṃ khayaṃ ñatvā, akataññū'si brāhmaṇa.
Example2:
assaddho akataññū ca, sandhicchedo ca yo naro,
hat'āvakāso vant'āso, sa ve uttamaporiso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not done evil; who has not done wrong
Meaning in native language: кто не делал зла; кто не сделал ничего плохого
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not made a refuge from fear; who has not made a protection against terror; (comm) who has not protected the fearful
Meaning in native language: кто не укрылся от страха; кто не защитился от ужаса; (комм) кто не защищал напуганных
Commentary: (ANa) bhītassa parittāyakattā bhīruttāṇan'ti vuccati.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not done cruel deeds
Commentary: (ANa) luddan'ti kakkhaḷakammaṃ.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not done; not made; not created
Example1: no ce’taṃ abhavissa ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ na’y’idha jātassa bhūtassa katassa saṅkhatassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāyetha.
Example2:
akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo, pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ’ca sukataṃ seyyo, yaṃ katvā n’ānutappati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: something not done; unperformed  action
Example1:
akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo, pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ'ca sukataṃ seyyo, yaṃ katvā n'ānutappati.
Example2:
na paresaṃ vilomāni, na paresaṃ kat'ākataṃ,
attano'va avekkheyya, katāni akatāni ca.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not doing; not making; not practising
Meaning in native language: не делающий; не совершающий; не практикующий
Example2: pānīyaparibhojanīya-upaṭṭhapanañ'ca; chand'ārahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chanda-āharaṇañ'ca; tesaññ'eva akata-uposathānaṃ pārisuddhiyā'pi āharaṇañ'ca

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who does not participate in the Uposatha

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not boasting (about)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not confused; without doubt; lit. not asking 'how?'
Meaning in native language: свободный от сомнений; досл. не спрашивающий 'как?'

Meaning IN CONTEXT: free from mud; free from filth
Example1: te taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhetvā suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā akaddamaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: class of devas; lit. not the youngest
Meaning in native language: класс божественных существ; досл. не самый молодой
Example1: tassa hi pathavito yāva akaniṭṭha-brahmalokā nīl'ādiārammaṇaṃ samosarantaṃ paripuṇṇabhāvaṃ kātuṃ na sakkoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unpleasant; unwelcome; disagreeable
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā
Example2: yan’dunnimittaṃ avamaṅgalañ’ca, yo c’āmanāpo sakuṇassa saddo, pāpaggaho dussupinaṃ akantaṃ, buddh’ānubhāvena vināsamentu

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not allowable; unsuitable; inappropriate; lit. not to be fit
Example1: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: un-constructed; un-fashioned; un-fabricated
Example1:
vītagedho amaccharī, na ussesu vadate muni,
na samesu na omesu, kappaṃ n'eti akappiyo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unblemished; spotless; pure
Meaning in native language: безупречный; не опороченный; чистый; не запятнанный
Example2: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhi-saṃvattanikāni

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-doing; non-action; absence of action
Example2:
sabba-pāpassa akaraṇaṃ, kusalassa upasampadā.
sacitta-pariyodapanaṃ, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: should not be done; could not be made
Meaning in native language: не должен быть сделан; не может быть выполнен

Meaning IN CONTEXT: undoable (for); lit. not to be done (for)
Example1: pariccattaṃ kho rañño nāgassa jīvitaṃ. n'atthi dāni kiñci rañño nāgassa akaraṇīyan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not doing
Example1:
yañ’hi kayirā tañ’hi vade, yaṃ na kayirā na taṃ vade.
akarontaṃ bhāsamānaṃ, parijānanti paṇḍitā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without trouble

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who gains without trouble

Meaning IN CONTEXT: they did; they made
Example1: bhikkhū ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṃ uttiṇam’akaṃsu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unwilling; reluctant
Example1: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañ'ca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unwillingly; reluctantly; with no choice in the matter; whether one wants to or not
Meaning in native language: независимо от желания; вынужденно; без выбора в этом вопросе
Commentary: (VINa) akāmā parivatthabban'ti na kāmena, na vasena, atha kho akāmena avasena parivāsaṃ samādāya vatthabbaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who is not a doer; who is not an agent; who is not the perpetrator; innocent
Meaning in native language: не деятель; не исполнитель; не преступник; невиновный
Example1: akārako'mhī'ti yo vādaṃ upeti so imehi dvīhi kāraṇehi vādaṃ upeti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (in debate) counter-argument

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not do-able; could not be done; impossible to do
Meaning in native language: не выполнимый; не может быть сделан; невозможно сделать

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having not caused to do; having not made
Example1: divāṭṭhāne nisinnakāle pana okāsaṃ kāretvā'va pucchantassa kathetabbo, akāretvā pucchantassa na kathetabbo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (vinaya) out of season robe cloth; unexpected robe
Meaning in native language: (виная) внесезонная ткань для одеяния; неожиданная одежда
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.3) akālacīvaraṃ nāma anatthate kathine ekādasamāse uppannaṃ, atthate kathine sattamāse uppannaṃ, kāle'pi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine bhikkhuno pan'eva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ paṭiggahetvā khippam’eva kāretabbaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who speaks at the improper time
Commentary:
(MNa) akālavādī'ti akālena vattā.
(ANa) akālavādī'ti kālasmiṃ na vadati, akālasmiṃ vadati nāma.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: out of season; unseasonal; lit. in wrong time
Meaning in native language: не сезонный; досл. в неверное время

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not delayed; immediate; timeless; (comm) giving immediate fruit
Meaning in native language: незамедлительный; безотлагательный; вневременный; (комм) дающий немедленный результат

Example2: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: at the wrong moment; at an unsuitable time; at an improper time
Meaning in native language: в неподходящий момент; в неподходящее время; в неуместное время
Commentary:
(MNa) akālenā'ti vattabbakālassa pubbe vā pacchā vā ayuttakāle vattā hoti.
(ANa) akālenā'ti kathetuṃ ayuttakālena.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: did; made

Example2: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam’anussaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: I did; I made

Example2: evaṃ vadeyya — ‘ahaṃ, bhante, pāpakammaṃ akāsiṃ gārayhaṃ mosallaṃ, yena me āyasmanto attamanā honti taṃ karomī’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (something which) should be not done; ought not to be made
Meaning in native language: (то что) не должно быть сделано; не следует совершать

akiccaṃ te na sevanti, kicce sātaccakārino,
satānaṃ sampajānānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who gains without difficulty

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not difficult; trouble-free; easy to get
Meaning in native language: не трудный; без проблем; легко получаемый

“dhanañ’ca puttaṃ bhariyañ’ca, chaḍḍayitvāna niggatā.
kaṭacchu-bhikkha-hetū’pi, akicchāni nisevare.

Meaning in native language: ни с чем; не имеющий; неимущий

Meaning IN CONTEXT: nothing; lit. not anything
Construction: na > a + ka > ki + iṃ + ci
Example1:
na brāhmaṇass'etad'akiñci seyyo, yadā nisedho manaso piyehi,
yato yato hiṃsamano nivattati, tato tato sammati'm'eva dukkhaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-doing; not doing

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (proponent of) doctrine of non-action; doctrine of inefficacy of action

Meaning IN CONTEXT: straight; not crooked
Construction:
na > a + √kuñc > kukk + u + ka
akukku + ka
Commentary: (MNa) akukkukajātan'ti pupphaggahaṇakāle anto aṅguṭṭhappamāṇo eko ghanadaṇḍako nibbattati, tena virahitan'ti attho
Example1: so tattha passeyya mahantaṃ kadali-kkhandhaṃ ujuṃ navaṃ akukkuka-jātaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: growing straight up; not crooked
Example1: so tattha passeyya mahantaṃ kadali-kkhandhaṃ ujuṃ navaṃ akukkukajātaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: free from bad behaviour; free from wrongdoing
Meaning in native language: свободный от плохого поведения; без проступков

akkodhano asantāsī, avikatthī akukkuco,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: nothing to fear from anywhere; with no reason for fear; lit. from nowhere fear
Meaning in native language: нечего не боящийся; без повода для страха; досл. из ниоткуда страх

na sakkā puññaṃ saṅkhātuṃ, im'ettam'api kenaci.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unshakable; unwavering
Example2: ñāṇañ’ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi — ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayam’antimā jāti, n’atthi-dāni punabbhavo’ti.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for one not doing (something)
Construction:
na > a + kubba + nta + to
akubbanta + to

n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti, n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not doing; not making
Example1:
okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not doing; not making; not creating
Meaning in native language: не делающий; не совершающий; не создающий
Example1:
mamāyite passatha phandamāne, macche'va app'odake khīṇasote,

ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yad'attagarahī tad'akubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unhealthy thinking; unwholesome thought; unskilful thinking
Meaning in native language: нездоровое мышление; не благая мысль; неумелое мышление
Example1: tayo'me, bhikkhave, akusalavitakkā — kāmavitakko, byāpādavitakko, vihiṃsāvitakko.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unbeneficial; useless; unskilful

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who is honest; who is not deceitful; who is straight-forward
Meaning in native language: тот кто честен; кто не обманывает; кто прямой
Example1:
patilīno akuhako, apihālu amaccharī,
appagabbho ajeguccho, pesuṇeyye ca no yuto.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: imperfect; incomplete; not an adept

sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhiparibbasānā, viggayha nānā kusalā vadanti,
yo evaṃ jānāti sa vedi dhammaṃ, idaṃ paṭikkosam'akevalī so.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unskilled (in); not expert (in); not proficient (in); not a master (of)
Meaning in native language: не обученный (в); не эксперт (в); не специалист (в); не мастер (в)
Example1: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto

Meaning IN CONTEXT: verbally abused
Example1:
akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ, ajini maṃ ahāsi me.
ye ca taṃ upanayhanti, veraṃ tesaṃ na sammati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: freedom from anger; absence of anger; meekness; lit. non-anger
Meaning in native language: свобода от гнева; отсутствие гнева; мягкость; досл. не гнев

Example2:

jine kadariyaṃ dānena, saccen'ālikavādinaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without anger; friendly; well disposed
Meaning in native language: беззлобный; свободный от гнева; дружелюбный; хорошо расположенный
Example1:
vicikiccho vā tiṇṇa-vicikiccho nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
kodhano vā akkodhano nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
saṃkiliṭṭha-citto vā asaṃkiliṭṭha-citto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
Example2:
akkodhanaṃ vatavantaṃ, sīlavantaṃ anussadaṃ,
dantaṃ antimasārīraṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: verbal abuse; insult
Example2:
akkosaṃ vadhabandhañ'ca, aduṭṭho yo titikkhati,
khantībalaṃ bal'ānīkaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: verbally abuses; insults
Example1: sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kin’ti bhavissatī”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sharp-shooter; lit. target piercing
Commentary:
(ANa) akkhaṇavedhī'ti avirādhitavedhī, akkhaṇaṃ vā vijju vijjantarikāya vijjhituṃ samattho'ti attho
(ANa) avirādhitaṃ vijjhatī'ti akkhaṇavedhī.
Example1: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇavedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: target; mark; butt
Example1: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇa-vedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gambler; who is addicted to gambling; lit. corrupted with dice
Meaning in native language: игрок; пристрастившийся к азартным играм; досл. испорченный игрой в кости
Example1: appamattako so, bhikkhave, kaṭaggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen’eva kaṭaggahena mahantaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ adhigaccheyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: impatient (with); intolerant (of); not able to endure
Example1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rūpānaṃ, akkhamo saddānaṃ, akkhamo gandhānaṃ, akkhamo rasānaṃ, akkhamo phoṭṭhabbānaṃ.
Example2: mār’ātirekam’abhiyujjhita-sabba-rattiṃ, ghoram’pan’āḷavakam’akkhama-thaddha-yakkhaṃ, khantī-sudanta-vidhinā jitavā mun’indo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: word; sound; syllable; lit. indestructible
Example1:
vītataṇho anādāno, niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ, jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,

Example2: ye pana te sutt'antā kavikatā kāveyyā citt'akkharā cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā, tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsissanti, sotaṃ odahissanti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: announced; told; declared
Example1:
etādis’āyaṃ santāno, māy’āyaṃ bālalāpinī,
vadhako esa akkhāto, sāro ettha na vijjati.
Example2:

te janā pāram’essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: to be spoken (about); to be declared (by); lit. to be said (by)
Meaning in native language: следует говорить (о); может быть объявленным; досл. может быть сказан
Example1: jhāyīh'ete, bhikkhave, samāpattikusalehi samāpattivuṭṭhānakusalehi samāpajjitvā vuṭṭhahitvā sammā akkhātabbānī'ti vadāmī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: speaker; who tells
Example1:
tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ, akkhātāro tathāgatā,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: says; tells; explains

Meaning IN CONTEXT: announcing; telling
Example1: chanda-parisuddhi, utu’kkhānaṃ, bhikkhu-gaṇanā ca, ovādo - uposathassa etāni pubbakiccan'ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: saying; speaking; declaring; announcing

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is considered; is said to be

Meaning IN CONTEXT: tale; story; narrative

Meaning IN CONTEXT: said; told; stated; declared

akkheyyasmiṃ patiṭṭhitā,
akkheyyaṃ apariññāya,
yogam'āyanti maccuno.

Example2: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhi-saṃvattanikāni

Meaning IN CONTEXT: highest thing; best thing; ultimate thing
Example1:
“pūti-macchaṃ kus’aggena, yo naro upanayhati.
kusā’pi pūtī vāyanti, evaṃ bāl’ūpasevanā”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: hall; room; space; place
Example1: bhikkhu-gaṇanā ca: imasmiṃ uposath’agge sannipatitānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā kittakā bhikkhū honti?
Example2: yāvakīvañ’ca bhikkhave bhikkhū sam’aggā sannipatissanti, sam’aggā vuṭṭhahissanti, sam’aggā saṅgha-karaṇīyāni karissanti
Example3: bhikkhugaṇanā nāma imasmiṃ uposath-agge uposath'atthāya sannipatitā bhikkhū ettakā'ti, bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fire
Example1:
atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati.
sehi kammehi dummedho, aggi-daḍḍho’va tappati.
Example3: kena ādittaṃ? ‘rāg’agginā, dos’agginā, moh’agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan’ti vadāmi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: bonfire; mass of fire
Example1: “aggikkhandh'ūpamā kāmā mah'ābhitāpan'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: burned by fire; consumed by fire
Example1:
atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho, aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fire worshipper; attendant of the sacred fire
Example1: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fire room; heated hall; lit. fire hall
Meaning in native language: каминная комната; отапливаемый зал; досл. огонь зал
Notes: (MW) place for keeping the sacrificial fire
Example1: sace te, kassapa, agaru, viharemu ajjuṇho aggisālamhī’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: flame; lit. crest of fire
Example1:
seyyo ayoguḷo bhutto, tatto aggisikhā-upamo,
yañ'ce bhuñjeyya dussīlo, raṭṭhapiṇḍam'asaññato.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fire sacrifice; fire oblation
Example1:
yamhā dhammaṃ vijāneyya, sammāsambuddhadesitaṃ,
sakkaccaṃ taṃ namasseyya, aggihuttaṃ'va brāhmaṇo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: attends the sacred fire; worships the sacrificial fire
Meaning in native language: следит за священным огнем; поклоняется жертвенному огню
Example1:
yo ca vassasataṃ jantu, aggiṃ paricare vane,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ, muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo, yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is worth; has the value (of)
Example1:
māse māse kus'aggena, bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ, kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: has the value (of); comes to the value (of)
Example1:
ken'esa yañño vipulo mahaggato,
samena dinnassa na aggham'eti,
kathaṃ sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: value; cost; price; worth
Example1:
ken'esa yañño vipulo mahaggato,
samena dinnassa na aggham'eti,
kathaṃ sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sacrificial room; room for keeping the sacred fire; lit. fire house
Meaning in native language: жертвенная комната; помещение для хранения священного огня; досл. дом огня
Commentary: (MNa) agy'āgāre'ti aggihomasālayaṃ.
Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammaṃ nāma kurūnaṃ nigamo, bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agy'āgāre tiṇasanthārake.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: hollow; empty; void; vacuous; lit. empty space state
Meaning in native language: полый; пустой; незаполненный; досл. состояние пустого пространства
Example1: aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: as trouble; as pain; as bad
Meaning in native language: как бедственный; как болезненный; как плохой
Commentary: (MNa) dukkh'aṭṭhena aghato
Example1: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: like a misfortune; like a trouble
Commentary: (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Example1: so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: root of misery; (or) void of a root
Example1: vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato aghamūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato mār'āmisato

Meaning IN CONTEXT: removal of trouble; elimination of suffering; lit. leading out bad
Meaning in native language: устранение неприятностей; исключение страданий; досл. вывод плохого
Commentary: (SNa) chandavinayā aghavinayo'ti taṇhāvinayena pañcakkhandhavinayo.
Example1: chandajaṃ aghaṃ chandajaṃ dukkhaṃ, chandavinayā aghavinayo, aghavinayā dukkhavinayo'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: empty space; void; vacuum of space
Commentary: (SNt) kenaci na ghaṭṭetī'ti aghaṃ
Example1: vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato agha-mūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato mār'āmisato
Example2: aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: trouble; misfortune; pain
Commentary:
(SNa) aghan'ti pañcakkhandhadukkhaṃ. dutiyapadaṃ tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
(SNa) aghan'ti evarūpassa hi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ āgatam'eva hoti.
Example1: chandajaṃ aghaṃ chandajaṃ dukkhaṃ, chandavinayā aghavinayo, aghavinayā dukkhavinayo'ti.
Example2: vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato agha-mūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato mār'āmisato

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not smelled
Example1: ye te ghānaviññeyyā gandhā aghāyitā aghāyitapubbā, na ca ghāyasi, na ca te hoti ghāyeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: never smelled before
Meaning in native language: никогда не обонял; не чувствовал раньше
Example1: ye te ghānaviññeyyā gandhā aghāyitā aghāyitapubbā, na ca ghāyasi, na ca te hoti ghāyeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: mahout; elephant driver; lit. holding a hooked pole
Example1: idaṃ pure cittam’acāri cārikaṃ, yen’icchakaṃ yatthakāmaṃ yathāsukhaṃ, tad’ajj’ahaṃ niggahessāmi yoniso, hatthi-ppabhinnaṃ viya aṅkusaggaho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: hooked pole; hook for controlling and driving an elephant; a goad
Meaning in native language: крюк; крюк для управления слоном; стрекало
Example1: idaṃ pure cittam’acāri cārikaṃ, yen’icchakaṃ yatthakāmaṃ yathāsukhaṃ, tad’ajj’ahaṃ niggahessāmi yoniso, hatthi-ppabhinnaṃ viya aṅkusa-ggaho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: spot; blemish; stain
Commentary: (ANa) aṅgaṇan'ti tatthajātak'āṅgakāḷatilak'ādiṃ
Example1: sace tattha passati rajaṃ vā aṅgaṇaṃ vā, tass'eva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: courtyard
Example1: ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: even a limb; just limb; (as his) very limb
Meaning in native language: даже конечность; просто конечность; именно (как его) конечность
Example1: aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: part of the body; some or other limb; major and minor limbs
Meaning in native language: часть тела; та или иная конечность; основные и второстепенные конечности
Notes: aṅga are the major limbs, trunk, head, arms and legs. paccaṅga are minor limbs such as forehead, nose, chin, fingers, ears etc.
Example1: suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabb’aṅgapaccaṅgiṃ;
Example2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ’ukkaṃ na khippam’eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: limb by limb; all the limbs; lit. limb and limb
Meaning in native language: конечность за конечностью; все конечности; досл. конечность и конечность
Example1: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅga-anusārino vātā, assāso passāso

Meaning IN CONTEXT: coursing through all the limbs
Example1: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅg'ānusārino vātā, assāso passāso

Meaning IN CONTEXT: accumulation of parts; collection of components
Example1:
yathā hi aṅgasambhārā,
hoti saddo ratho iti,
evaṃ khandhesu santesu,
hoti satto'ti sammuti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: a constituent part of the body; a limb; member
Example1: “ubhato-daṇḍakena ce’pi kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam’aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatrā’pi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsana-karo.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāya-saṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya, hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: factor; component; element; quality; aspect
Example1:
yathā hi aṅga-sambhārā, hoti saddo ratho iti.
evaṃ khandhesu santesu, hoti satto’ti sammuti
Example2: handa mayaṃ satta-sambojjh’aṅga-pāṭhaṃ bhaṇāmase

Meaning IN CONTEXT: vow; practice; means
Example1: sambahulā bhikkhū santhatāni ujjhitvā āraññik’aṅgaṃ piṇḍapātik’aṅgaṃ paṃsukūlik’aṅgaṃ samādiyiṃsu

Meaning IN CONTEXT: Bengalis; people of Bengal
Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati āpaṇaṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: burning embers; charcoal
Example1: tam’enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgāra-kāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: pit of burning coals
Example1: tam’enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.
Example2: “aṅgārakās'ūpamā kāmā mahāpariḷāh'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: like a pit of burning coals; similar to a charcoal pit
Meaning in native language: как яма с горящими углями; похожий на угольную яму
Commentary:
(MNa) aṅgārakās'ūpamā mah'ābhitāpan'aṭṭhena.
(ANa) aṅgārakās'ūpamā'ti santāpan'aṭṭhena aṅgārakāsuyā upamitā ime kāmā'ti.
Example1: aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā ... maṃsapes'ūpamā ... tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā ... aṅgārakās'ūpamā ... supinak'ūpamā ... yācitak'ūpamā ... rukkhaphal'ūpamā ... asisūn'ūpamā ... sattisūl'ūpamā ... sappasir'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: consisting of x parts; composed of x factors
Meaning in native language: состоящий из (стольки-то) частей; содержащий из (стольки-то) элементов
Example1: paṭhamaṃ pan'āvuso, jhānaṃ kati-aṅgikan'ti? paṭhamaṃ kho, āvuso, jhānaṃ pañc'aṅgikaṃ.
Example2: ayam’eva ariyo aṭṭh’aṅgiko maggo seyyath’īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: big toe; thumb
Meaning in native language: большой палец ноги; большой палец руки
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amussa āsīvisassa ghoravisassa hatthaṃ vā aṅguṭṭhaṃ vā dajjā yaṃ jaññā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: thumb-print; impression of the thumb
Meaning in native language: отпечаток большого пальца; след от большого пальца
Example1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, palagaṇḍassa vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsissa vā vāsijaṭe dissant'eva aṅgulipadāni dissati aṅguṭṭhapadaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: inch; finger breadth
Example1: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭh’aṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugat’aṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: tickling; lit. poking with fingers
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.52) aṅgulipatodako nāma aṅguliyā'pi tudanti, upasampanno upasampannaṃ has'ādhippāyo kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
(VINa) aṅgulipatodakenā'ti aṅgulīhi upakacchak'ādighaṭṭanaṃ vuccati.
Example1: aṅgulipatodake, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fingerprint; impression of the finger
Example1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, palagaṇḍassa vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsissa vā vāsijaṭe dissant'eva aṅgulipadāni dissati aṅguṭṭhapadaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: joint of the finger; finger knuckle
Example1: hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo, yaṃ mahāsamudde aṅgulipabba-temanamattam'pi udakaṃ na hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: enough to wet the finger knuckle; lit. finger knuckle wetting measure
Example1: hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo, yaṃ mahāsamudde aṅgulipabbatemanamattam'pi udakaṃ na hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: personal name of an arahant monk; lit. garland of fingers
Meaning in native language: имя монаха архата; досл. гирлянда из пальцев
Example3:
coro ahaṃ pure āsiṃ, aṅgulimālo'ti vissuto.
vuyhamāno mah'oghena, buddhaṃ saraṇam'āgamaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: finger
Example1: tesaṃ rasapathaviṃ aṅguliyā sāyataṃ acchādesi, taṇhā ca tesaṃ okkami.
Example2: ukkhitta-khaggam-atihattha-sudāruṇan’taṃ, dhāvan’ti-yojana-path’aṅguli-mālavantaṃ. iddhī’bhisaṅkhata-mano jitavā mun’indo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sightless; visionless; lit. eyeless
Example1: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: bad looking; not good for the eyes; lit. not for the eye
Meaning in native language: плохо выглядящий; не радующий глаз; досл. не для глаза
Commentary: (ANa) acakkhussan'ti na cakkhūnaṃ hitaṃ, cakkhuṃ visuddhaṃ na karoti.
Example1: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane. katame pañca? acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa nacchādeti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: steady; steadfast; not shaking
Example1:
anuddhato acapalo, nipako saṃvut’indriyo,
sobhati paṃsukūlena, sīho’va girigabbhare.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having not lived; having not led one's life; lit. having not walked
Meaning in native language: не прожив; не проведя свою жизнь; досл. не пройдя
Example1:
acaritvā brahmacariyaṃ, aladdhā yobbane dhanaṃ,
jiṇṇakoñcā'va jhāyanti, khīṇamacche'va pallale.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not later
Example1: saññā nu kho, bhante, paṭhamaṃ uppajjati, pacchā ñāṇaṃ, udāhu ñāṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ uppajjati, pacchā saññā, udāhu saññā ca ñāṇañ'ca apubbaṃ acarimaṃ uppajjantī'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: lived; wandered around
Example1:
sokapparidevamaccharaṃ, na jahanti giddhā mamāyite,
tasmā munayo pariggahaṃ, hitvā acariṃsu khemadassino.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unshakeable; immobile; stationary; stable
Example1: seyyathā’pi rañño paccantime nagare esikā hoti gambhīranemā sunikhātā acalā asampavedhī abbhantarānaṃ guttiyā bāhirānaṃ paṭighātāya. evam’evaṃ kho ariyasāvako saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: walked around; wandered around; roamed
Example1: idaṃ pure cittam’acāri cārikaṃ, yen’icchakaṃ yatthakāmaṃ yathāsukhaṃ, tad’ajj’ahaṃ niggahessāmi yoniso, hatthi-ppabhinnaṃ viya aṅkusaggaho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: thought (about); pondered (over)
Example2:
bahū devā manussā ca, maṅgalāni acintayuṃ.
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ, brūhi maṅgalam’uttamaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of time) not long; soon; recent
Example1: atha kho acira-pakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: recently departed; soon left
Example1: atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.
Example2: atha kho āyasmā channo acirapakkantesu tesu āyasmantesu satthaṃ āharesi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: recently ordained
Example1: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: soon; before long; lit. not long
Example2:
aciraṃ vat’ayaṃ kāyo, paṭhaviṃ adhisessati.
chuddho apeta-viññāṇo, niratthaṃ’va kaliṅgaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not long after one ordained; shortly after ordination
Example1: acir'ūpasampanno kho pan'āyasmā māgaṇḍiyo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto viharanto nacirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unconscious; inanimate; senseless; mindless
Meaning in native language: не наделенный сознанием; неодушевленный; без сознания
Example1:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, yadā kāyaṃ jahant’imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti, parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
Example2: tiṭṭhantu tāva manussabhūtā, acetanānaṃ rukkhānam’pi sāmaggiṃ laddhuṃ vaṭṭati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not thinking; not having mental activity
Meaning in native language: не думающий; не имеющий умственной активности
Example1: tassa acetayato anabhisaṅkharoto tā c'eva saññā nirujjhanti, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā na uppajjanti. so nirodhaṃ phusati. evaṃ kho, poṭṭhapāda, anupubb'ābhisaññānirodha-sampajāna-samāpatti hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not thinking; not having mental activity
Meaning in native language: не думающий; не имеющий умственной активности
Example1: so tato amutra tato amutra anupubbena saññ'aggaṃ phusati. tassa saññ'agge ṭhitassa evaṃ hoti, cetayamānassa me pāpiyo, acetayamānassa me seyyo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: naked ascetic; lit. unclothed
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.41) acelako nāma yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno naggo.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (prefix)
Example1:
sodha sibbinim’acca-gā’ti
icc’evam accanta-namassanīyaṃ
Example2:
yo-accanta-suddhabbara-ñāṇa-locano
so vo mam’accayena satthā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: had overcome; had surpassed; had got past
Example1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: had overcome; had surpassed; had got past
Example1: “yo ubho’nte viditvāna, majjhe mantā na lippati. taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso’ti, so’dha sibbinim’accagā”ti.
Example2:
yo'maṃ palipathaṃ duggaṃ, saṃsāraṃ moham'accagā,
tiṇṇo pāragato jhāyī, anejo akathaṃkathī,
anupādāya nibbuto, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: crossed beyond; transcended; overcome; escaped
Meaning in native language: перешагнул за пределы; превзошел; преодолел; спасся
Example1:
yo imaṃ samuddaṃ sagāhaṃ sarakkhasaṃ,
saūmiṃ sāvaṭṭaṃ sabhayaṃ duttaraṃ accatari.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: extreme bad behaviour; extreme immorality
Example1:
yassa accantadussīlyaṃ, māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ, yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: completely finished; absolutely done

Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: completely concluded; absolutely finished

Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: completed the holy life; finished the spiritual journey; (or) completely celibate; absolutely chaste
Meaning in native language: завершил святую жизнь; закончил духовное путешествие; (или) полностью целомудренный; абсолютно непорочный

Meaning IN CONTEXT: completely safe; absolutely free from bondage
Meaning in native language: в полной безопасности; абсолютно свободный от зависимости
Commentary: (ANa) accantayogakkhemī'ti accantaṃ yogakkhemī, niccayogakkhemī'ti attho.
Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: complete; absolute; ultimate; lit. up to the end
Example1: “vuttam’idaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā sakkapañhe — ‘ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttā, te accanta-niṭṭhā accanta-yogakkhemino accanta-brahmacārino accanta-pariyosānā seṭṭhā devamanussānan’ti.

yassa accanta-dussīlyaṃ, māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ, yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

Meaning in native language: выходит за рамки; проходит; превосходит; превышает
Example1:
sakañ'hi diṭṭhiṃ katham'accayeyya, chand'ānunīto ruciyā niviṭṭho,

Meaning in native language: признает ошибку; досл. признает ошибку ошибкой
Example1: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fault; offence; transgression; lit. going beyond (the norm)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: went too far; overshot the mark
Example1: accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ.

ati > aty > acc + √i > ay + *a + ena
accaya + ena

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is at fault; lit. fault has overcome

Meaning IN CONTEXT: had given offence; had transgressed; had overstepped; lit. had gone to far
Meaning in native language: обидел; нарушил; перешел границы; досл. зашел слишком далеко
Example1: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: placing; lit. putting on
Example2: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappeyyāsi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasikaritvā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too tight; too sharply tuned; overstretched
Meaning in native language: слишком тугой; слишком резко настроенный; перенапряженный

ati + āyata

Meaning IN CONTEXT: urgent; pressing; extraordinary

Meaning IN CONTEXT: everlasting; eternal; stable; epithet of Nibbāna; lit. not falling away; not vanishing

accharā-gaṇasaṅghuṭṭhaṃ,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: worthy of being honoured; lit. should make anjali to
Meaning in native language: достойный уважения; досл. следует сложить вместе ладони в жесте почтения
Example2: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one or other; all kinds
Example2: aññatar’aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa, aññatar’aññatarena dukkha-dhammena phuṭṭhassa; soko, socanā, socitattaṃ, antosoko antoparisoko

Meaning IN CONTEXT: any one (of); one or another
Example1: yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ. yathā pure tathā pacchā, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
Example2: 'yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: a certain; a
Example1: tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rog’ātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti — ‘piyā vata maṃ kāmā jahissanti, piye c’āhaṃ kāme jahissāmī’ti.
Example2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta-vaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one (of); either one (of)
Example1: idha ekacco aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ paṇidhāya brahmacariyaṃ carati — ‘imin’āhaṃ sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devo vā bhavissāmi dev’aññataro vā’ti. ayaṃ vuccati amanussaggāho.
Example2: ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabb’ete pañc’upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.
Example3: niṭṭhite ca pubbakicce: sace so divaso cātuddasī-paṇṇarasī-sāmaggīnam'aññataro, yath'ājja uposatho paṇṇaraso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who belongs to another sect; who follows another religion; lit. another fording place
Meaning in native language: кто принадлежит к другой секте; кто следует другой религии; досл. другая переправа
Example1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etad’ahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten’upasaṅkameyyāmā’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who belonged to another sect before; who previously followed another religion; lit. another fording place before
Meaning in native language: кто раньше принадлежал к другой секте; кто ранее исповедовал другую религию; досл. другое место брода до этого
Example1: yo kho, sabhiya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, so cattāro māse parivasati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: from another
Example1:
na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha, diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto, attañjaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.
Example2:
ajjhattam'ev'upasame, na aññato bhikkhu santim'eseyya,
ajjhattaṃ upasantassa, n'atthi attāṃ kuto nirattāṃ vā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: except at the right time; other than at the correct occasion
Meaning in native language: кроме как в нужное время; кроме верных обстоятельств
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.23) aññatra samayā'ti ṭhapetvā samayaṃ.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhun’ūpassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: apart (from); aside (from); other (than); except (for)
Commentary: (VIN 1.1.4) aññatra adhimānā'ti ṭhapetvā adhimānaṃ.
Example1: ‘na kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṃ taṃ sukhaṃ aññatr’eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
Example2: “sañcetanikā sukka-vissaṭṭhi aññatra supin’antā saṅghādiseso”ti.
Example3: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without; nothing to do (with); completely separate (from); lit. just apart (from)
Meaning in native language: без; не имеющий ничего общего (с); полностью отдельный (от); досл. именно кроме
Example1: yāh'ayaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, rati, aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi, api dibbaṃ sukhaṃ samadhigayha tiṭṭhati, tāya ratiyā ramamāno hīnassa na pihemi, na tattha abhiramāmi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: change; alteration; lit. otherwise state
Example1: rañño'pi kho, bhikkhave, pasenadissa kosalassa atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: change of mind; change of opinion; lit. otherwise state
Meaning in native language: перемена в уме; изменение мнения; досл. иное состояние
Example1: atha khv’etaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānañ’c’eva appasādāya, pasannānañ’ca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
Example2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: differently; otherwise; lit. in another way
Example1:
yena yena hi maññanti, tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
etādiso vinābhāvo, passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.
Example2:
aññathā lokanāthamhi, tiṭṭhante puris'uttame.
iriyaṃ āsi bhikkhūnaṃ, aññathā dāni dissati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: change; alteration; lit. being otherwise
Example1: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc’eva akkhātaṃ – sabbeh’eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo
Example2: tassa ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyino taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti. tassa rūpavipariṇām’aññathābhāvā uppajjanti soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass’upāyāsā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: different existence; being elsewhere; another state of existence; lit. being otherwise
Meaning in native language: другое существование; бытие в другом месте; другое состояние существования; досл. другое бытие
Example1:
jātimaraṇasaṃsāraṃ,
ye vajanti punappunaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
avijjāy'eva sā gati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: changing; altering; lit. becoming otherwise
Example1: cakkhu aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi. rūpā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino. itth’etaṃ dvayaṃ calañ’c’eva byathañ’ca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one thing ... another; in one way ... in another way
Meaning in native language: одно ... другое; одним способом ... другим способом
Commentary: (SNa) aññathā santan'ti aññen'ākārena bhūtaṃ.
Example1:
aññathā santam'attānaṃ,
aññathā yo pavedaye,
nikacca kitavass'eva,
bhuttaṃ theyyena tassa taṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: alters; changes; becomes different
Example1: tassa ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyino taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti. tassa rūpavipariṇām’aññathābhāvā uppajjanti soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass’upāyāsā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: most certainly; indeed; only; lit. other it may be
Meaning in native language: наверняка; определенно; только; досл. по другому может быть
Example1: tatra bhikkhu viveka-ninnena cittena viveka-poṇena viveka-pabbhārena viveka-ṭṭhena nekkhamm’ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanika-paṭisaṃyuttaṃ-y’eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: on the contrary; however; but; lit. different it may be
Meaning in native language: с другой стороны; однако; напротив; но; досл. по другому может быть
Example1: ‘kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ añña'd'atthu bhaya-paṭikaṅkhī viharāmi? yaṃnūn’āhaṃ yathābhūtaṃ yathābhūtassa me taṃ bhayabheravaṃ āgacchati, tathābhūtaṃ tathābhūtova taṃ bhayabheravaṃ paṭivineyyan’ti
Example3: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n’eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam’eva alattha

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (vinaya) belonging to another class; connected with another category (of offences)
Meaning in native language: (виная) принадлежащий к другому классу; связанный с другой категорией (нарушений)
Commentary: (VIN 1.2.9) kathaṃ āpatt'ādhikaraṇaṃ āpatt'ādhikaraṇassa tabbhāgiyaṃ? methunadhammapārājik'āpatti methunadhammapārājik'āpattiyā tabbhāgiyā.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ, duṭṭho doso appatīto, aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: and if really belonging to another class; just if connected with another category
Meaning in native language: и если действительно принадлежащий к другому классу; именно если связанный с другой категорией
Example1: aññabhāgiyañ’c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti koci deso lesamatto upādinno bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: mutual; one another; one to another
Example1:
“pariccajitvā saddhammaṃ, aññam’aññehi bhaṇḍare.
diṭṭhigatāni anventā, idaṃ seyyo’ti maññare.
Example2: hetu-paccayo, ārammaṇa-paccayo, adhipati-paccayo, anantara-paccayo, samanantara-paccayo, sahajāta-paccayo, aññam’añña-paccayo,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one to another
Example1: pañc'imāni, bho gotama, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti.
Example2:
na paro paraṃ nikubbetha, n’ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kañci
byārosanā, paṭigha-saññā, n’āññam’aññassa dukkham’iccheyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: admonishing to one another; speaking to each other
Meaning in native language: наставление друг с друга; разговор друг с другом
Example1: āyasmā'pi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena bhikkhū'pi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena, evaṃ saṃvaddhā hi tassa bhagavato parisā, yad'idaṃ aññam’añña’vacanena aññam’aññaṃ’vuṭṭhāpanenā”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: helping to rehabilitate each other; mutual support
Meaning in native language: помощь реабилитировать друг друга; взаимная поддержка
Example1: āyasmā'pi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena bhikkhū'pi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena, evaṃ saṃvaddhā hi tassa bhagavato parisā, yad'idaṃ aññam’añña-vacanena aññam’añña’vuṭṭhāpanenā”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: emancipation by another person; being freed by someone else
Meaning in native language: избавление другим человеком; освобождение кем-то другим
Example1:
icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā, te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure vā'pi apekkhamānā, im'eva kāme purime'va jappaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: dodging; changing topic; evasive speech; lit. talking different
Meaning in native language: увиливание; изменение темы; уклончивая речь; досл. говорящий другое
Commentary: (VINa) ettha aññaṃ vadatī'ti aññavādakaṃ, aññen'aññaṃ paṭicaraṇass'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
Example1: aññavādake vihesake, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one thing … another
Example1: vuccati cittaṃ iti’pi, mano iti’pi, viññāṇaṃ iti’pi, taṃ rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññaṃ nirujjhati.
Example2:
aññā hi lābh'ūpanisā, aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya, bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya, vivekam'anubrūhaye.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: another; other; different
Example1: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan’ti?
Example2: “nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ, aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya. samūlaṃ taṇham’abbuyha, nicchāto parinibbuto”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: something more; something further; something else
Meaning in native language: что-то большее; что-то дальше; что-то еще
Example1:
yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tad'iṅgha brūhi,
ettāvat'aggaṃ nu vadanti h'eke,
yakkhassa suddhiṃ idha paṇḍitāse,
udāhu aññam'pi vadanti etto.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: ignorance (of); lack of understanding (of); not knowing (about)
Example2: dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: ignorance (of); lack of understanding (of); not knowing (about)
Example1: na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañ’ca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno tañ’ca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unrelated; not blood-related; lit. unknown
Meaning in native language: не родственный; не связанный кровью; досл. не знакомый
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.4) aññātikā nāma mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpeyya, aññatra samayā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. tatth’āyaṃ samayo: acchinnacīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu naṭṭha cīvaro vā. ayaṃ tattha samayo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for the sake of understanding; for the purpose of knowledge
Commentary: (ANa) aññāt'atthan'ti jānan'atthaṃ.
Example1:
aññāt'atthaṃ pasād'atthaṃ, sataṃ ve hoti mantanā,
evaṃ kho ariyā mantenti, esā ariyāna mantanā,
etad'aññāya medhāvī, na samusseyya mantaye'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: should be understood (by); to be known (by)
Meaning in native language: следует быть понят (кем-то); должен быть известен (кому-то)
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.71) aññātabban'ti jānitabbaṃ.
Example1: sikkhamānena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aññātabbaṃ, paripucchitabbaṃ, paripañhitabbaṃ. ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who understands; who comprehends
Example1: saṃkhittena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, vitthārena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, saṃkhittavitthārena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, aññātāro ca dullabhā'ti.
Example2:
uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke,
desassu bhagavā dhammaṃ,
aññātāro bhavissantī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (in debate) assertion about what is known
Meaning in native language: (в дискуссии) утверждение о том что известно
Commentary: (ANa) aññātavāde saṇṭhātī'ti imaṃ pañhaṃ pucchitvā, suṭṭhu te pañho pucchito, pucchantena nāma evaṃ pucchitabban'ti vutte sampaṭicchati, vimatiṃ na uppādeti. pañhaṃ kathetvā'pi, suṭṭhu te pañho kathito, kathentena nāma evaṃ kathetabban'ti vutte sampaṭicchati, vimatiṃ na uppādeti.
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññātavāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not known; unknown; not recognised
Example1: seyyathā’pi dovāriko hoti paṇḍito byatto medhāvī aññātānaṃ nivāretā ñātānaṃ pavesetā, evam’evaṃ kho ariyasāvako satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena samannāgato cirakatam’pi cirabhāsitam’pi saritā anussaritā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: known; understood
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññāta-vāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: the faculty of (having) complete insight
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who is enlightened; who has final knowledge; who possesses perfect knowledge; lit. who has understood
Meaning in native language: просветленный; обладающий высшим знанием; абсолютным пониманием; досл. тот кто понял
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unrelated; not blood-related
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.4) aññātikā nāma mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: to know; to understand
Example1: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, bhante, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: breakthrough to spiritual insight; penetration to final knowledge
Meaning in native language: прорыв к духовному прозрению; проникновение в окончательное знание
Example1: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññāsamāpatti tāvatā aññāpaṭivedho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: understanding; comprehending; knowing
Example1:
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā, dukkhass'antaṃ karissatha,
akkhāto vo mayā maggo, aññāya sallakantanaṃ.
Example2:
sace c'assa kathākāmo, kālam'aññāya paṇḍito,
dhammaṭṭhapaṭisaṃyuttā, yā ariyacaritā kathā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: by gnosis; with spiritual insight; by enlightenment
Example1:
yass'ālayā na vijjanti, aññāya akathaṃkathī,
amat'ogadham'anuppattaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: peace of gnosis; calm of enlightenment
Example1:
ye ca phassaṃ pariññāya,
aññāy'upasame ratā,
te ve phass'ābhisamayā,
nicchātā parinibbutā'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: attainment of final knowledge; accomplishment in spiritual insight
Meaning in native language: достижение окончательного знания; совершенство в духовном прозрении
Example1: kathañ’ca, bhikkhave, anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā aññ’ārādhanā hoti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: knew; understood
Example1: ‘upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante’ti, tadā’pi so vadhako’va. vadhakañ’ca pana santaṃ na aññāsi — ‘vadhako me’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: spiritual insight; enlightenment; lit. understanding
Example1: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññā-samāpatti tāvatā aññā-paṭivedho
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: to understanding; for comprehension
Commentary: (MNa) na aññā'ti jānan'atthāya cittaṃ na upaṭṭhapenti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: the faculty of knowing; the power of insight

Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: others; other people; the rest
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ: nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo'ti
Example2:
“rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti.
ūnā’va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h’atthi titti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one (thing) with another
Example1: sac’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen’aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ’ca dosañ’ca appaccayañ’ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: dodges one question with another; evades one question with another; lit. walking back one thing with another
Meaning in native language: уклоняется от одного вопроса другим; досл. ходит назад одной вещью с другой
Commentary: (VINa) īdisaṃ tayā kiñci diṭṭhan'ti puṭṭho, na suṇāmī'ti sotam'upanento vā, sotadvāre pucchantānaṃ cakkhuṃ upanento vā, aññen'aññaṃ paṭicaratī'ti veditabbo.
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: by one other; by just one more
Example1: siyā aññena'pi pariyāyena sammā dvayat'ānupassanā'ti, iti ce, bhikkhave, pucchitāro assu, siyā'ti'ssu vacanīyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one (thing) with another

Meaning IN CONTEXT: even others; even other people

hananti bhogā dummedhaṃ, no ca pāragavesino,
bhogataṇhāya dummedho, hanti aññ'eva attanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: looking for faults (to attack) in one another
Meaning in native language: ищущий недостатки друг друга (для того чтобы атаковать)
Commentary: (ANa) añño'ññavivar'esino'ti aññam'aññassa chiddaṃ aparādhaṃ gavesamānā.
Example1:
ye viruddhā sallapanti, viniviṭṭhā samussitā,
anariyaguṇam'āsajja, añño'ññavivar'esino.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one another; mutual

ye viruddhā sallapanti, viniviṭṭhā samussitā,
anariyaguṇam'āsajja, añño'ñña-vivar'esino.

dubbhāsitaṃ vikkhalitaṃ, sampamohaṃ parājayaṃ,
añño'ññass'ābhinandanti, tadariyo katha-n'ācare.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: frame of a bed
Example1: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭh’aṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugat’aṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unrest in the wilderness; disturbance in the countryside; (comm) invasion of forest thieves

Example1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti so samayo yaṃ bhayaṃ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamāruḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: wilderness; forest; countryside

Meaning IN CONTEXT: afflicted (with); suffering (with); hurt (by)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is troubled (by); is repelled (by); is perturbed (by)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is troubled (by); is repelled (by); is perturbed (by)
Example1: pathaviyaṃ sucim’pi vā asucim’pi vā gūtha-gatam’pi vā mutta-gatam’pi vā kheḷa-gatam’pi vā pubba-gatam’pi vā lohita-gatam’pi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā
Example2: idh’ānanda, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāresu aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is troubled by, ashamed of and disgusted with
Example1: evam’evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, iminā pūtikāyena aṭṭīyāmi harāyāmi jigucchāmi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: being troubled (by); being repelled (by); being perturbed (by)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: should be troubled (by); should be worried (about); lit. to be troubled (by)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: should be troubled, ashamed and disgusted; should be distressed disturbed and repulsed

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having been troubled (by); having been perturbed (by)
