Meaning IN CONTEXT: wealthy; rich; loaded; (comm) with power
Meaning in native language: состоятельный; богатый; при деньгах; (комм) с властью
Commentary: (SNa) aḍḍhā'ti issarā
Example1: seyyathā’pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo; so ca ārakkha-sampanno.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: subtle; tiny; minute; atomic
Example2:
ye keci pāṇa-bhūt’atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā ye mahantā vā, majjhimā rassak’āṇuka-thūlā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: tiniest; smallest; lit. atom sized
Meaning in native language: очень маленький; крошечный; досл. размером с  мельчайшую частицу
Example1:
yāva hi vanatho na chijjati, aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so, vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.
Example2: ‘ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkha-saṃvara-saṃvuto viharāhi ācāra-gocara-sampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya-dassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: a very small; subtle; trivial
Example2: passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n’ādhivāseyyāthā”ti?
Example3: ‘ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkha-saṃvara-saṃvuto viharāhi ācāra-gocara-sampanno aṇu-mattesu vajjesu bhaya-dassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: subtle; fine
Example1:
sabbhi’r’eva samāsetha, paṇḍiteh’atthadassibhi,
atthaṃ mahantaṃ gambhīraṃ, duddasaṃ nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ,
dhīrā samadhigacchanti, appamattā vicakkhaṇā’ti.
Example2: passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n’ādhivāseyyāthā”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: egg
Example1:
kikī’va aṇḍaṃ, camarī’va vāladhiṃ. piyaṃ’va puttaṃ,
nayanaṃ’va ekakaṃ. tath’eva sīlaṃ, anurakkhamānā.
Example2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of speech) harsh; angry; fierce; wrathful
Example1: pharusavāco hoti. yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā parakaṭukā par'ābhisajjanī kodhasāmantā asamādhisaṃvattanikā, tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: eggshell
Example1: kiñ'c'āpi tassā kukkuṭiyā evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho, vata me kukkuṭapotakā pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena vā aṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyyun'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: weak; fragile; lit. become like an egg
Meaning in native language: слабый; хрупкий; досл. ставший как яйцо
Commentary: (SNa) aṇḍabhūto'ti aṇḍaṃ viya bhūto dubbalo. yathā kukkuṭaṇḍaṃ vā mayūraṇḍaṃ vā geṇḍukaṃ viya gahetvā khipantena vā paharantena vā na sakkā kīḷituṃ, tāva'd'eva bhijjati, evamayam'pi kāyo kaṇṭakepi khāṇukepi pakkhalitassa bhijjatīti aṇḍaṃ viya bhūto'ti aṇḍabhūto.
Example1: evam'etaṃ, gahapati, evam'etaṃ, gahapati! āturo h'āyaṃ, gahapati, kāyo aṇḍabhūto pariyonaddho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sea; ocean; body of water
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udaka-aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.
Example2: buddho susuddho karuṇā-mah’aṇṇavo, yo’ccanta-suddhabbara-ñāṇa-locano, lokassa pāp’ūpakilesa-ghātako

Meaning IN CONTEXT: day; part of the day; time of the day
Example1: tam’enaṃ pubb’aṇhasamayaṃ satti-satena haneyyuṃ. atha rājā majjh’anhikasamayaṃ evaṃ vadeyya — ‘ambho, kathaṃ so puriso’ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: beyond logic; outside the realm of conjecture; beyond the realm of thought
Meaning in native language: за пределами логики; вне сферы предположений; за пределами воображения
Example1: tassa nissaraṇaṃ santaṃ, atakk’āvacaraṃ dhuvaṃ. ajātaṃ asamuppannaṃ, asokaṃ virajaṃ padaṃ. nirodho dukkhadhammānaṃ, saṅkhār’ūpasamo sukho’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: untrue; false
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, yaṃ jaññā rahovādaṃ abhūtaṃ atacchaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ sasakkaṃ taṃ rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: untruth; not fact
Example1: taṃ me taṇhāsallaṃ pahīnaṃ, apanīto avijjāvisadoso, sammā nibbānādhimuttohamasmī’ti. evaṃmānī assa atathaṃ samānaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: energetic; effortful; active; alert; lit. not lazy
Meaning in native language: энергичный; усердный; активный; в состоянии готовности; досл. не ленивый
Example1:
ek'āsanaṃ ekaseyyaṃ, eko caram'atandito,
eko damayam'attānaṃ, van'ante ramito siyā.
Example2: evaṃ vihārim’ātāpiṃ, ahorattam’atanditaṃ. taṃ ve bhadd’eka-ratto’ti, santo ācikkhate muni.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not lazy; without sloth
Example2: etā pi buddha-jaya-maṅgala-aṭṭha-gāthā, yo vācano dina-dine sarate’m’atandī, hitvān’aneka-vividhāni c’upaddavāni, mokkhaṃ sukhaṃ adhigameyya naro sapañño

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not identified (with); lit. not made of that (in)
Meaning in native language: не отождествленный (с); досл. не произведенный из этого (в)
Commentary: (ANa) atammayo’ti tammayā vuccanti taṇhādiṭṭhiyo, tāhi rahito.
Example1: sabbaloke ca atammayo bhavissāmi, ahaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti, mamaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti,
Example2:
pasayha māraṃ abhibhuyya antakaṃ, yo ca phusī jātikkhayaṃ padhānavā,
so tādiso lokavidū sumedho, sabbesu dhammesu atammayo munī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: principle of non-identification (with); lit. state of not being made of that
Meaning in native language: принцип не отождествления (с); досл. состояние не быть сделанным из этого
Commentary: (MNa) atammayatā'ti tammayatā vuccati taṇhā, nittaṇhā'ti attho.
Example1: atammayataṃ, bhikkhave, nissāya atammayataṃ āgamma y’āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā taṃ pajahatha, taṃ samatikkamatha.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not hurrying; slowly
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, ataramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi na kilamati, cittam'pi na upahaññati, saro'pi na upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi na āturīyati, visaṭṭham'pi hoti viññeyyaṃ ataramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: being not in a hurry; not making haste
Example1: rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya, sammukhā na khīṇaṃ bhaṇe. ataramāno’va bhāseyya, no taramāno.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: crossed (over); made it across
Example1: yo taṃ rūpamayaṃ vegaṃ sahati, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, atari cakkhusamuddaṃ saūmiṃ sāvaṭṭaṃ sagāhaṃ sarakkhasaṃ.
Example2:
taṃ brūmi upasanto'ti, kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
ganthā tassa na vijjanti, atarī so visattikaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without refuge; defenseless; without protection
Example1: bhayato upasaggato calato pabhaṅguto adhuvato atāṇato aleṇato asaraṇato rittato tucchato suññato anattato ādīnavato

Meaning IN CONTEXT: crossed (over); made it across
Notes: with metrically lengthened ā ; or because sk is atāri
Example1: “saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paro’parāni, yass’iñjitaṃ n’atthi kuhiñci loke. santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso, atāri so jātijaran’ti brūmī”ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: beyond; over; past; very
Commentary:
atisīta - too cold
atisitvā - having bypassed, having overlooked
atīta - past, gone past
Notes:
atimānī – one who is proud, conceited
accaya - the death; lit. going beyond
Example1:
ati-sītan’ti, ati-uṇhan’ti, ati-sāyan’ti, ati-pāto’ti, ati-chāto’smī’ti, ati-dhāto’smī’ti
aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva ati-sitvā
atī’tam’p’āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam’eva rūpena khajjiṃ
Example2:
suvaco c’assa mudu, an’ati’mānī
so vo mam’acc-ayena satthā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too hot
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: surpassing normal human ability; lit. surpassed human
Meaning in native language: превосходящий нормальные человеческие способности; досл. превзошедший человека
Example1: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate, yathākamm’ūpage satte pajānāti
Example2: dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ, dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gone beyond; surpassed
Example1: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta-mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate, yathākamm’ūpage satte pajānāti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gone past; passed by
Example1: utu’kkhānaṃ: hemant’ādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ utūnaṃ, ettakaṃ atikkantaṃ, ettakaṃ avasiṭṭhan'ti. evaṃ utu-ācikkhanaṃ kataṃ kiṃ?
Example2: iminā pakkhena: eko uposatho sampatto, eko uposathā atikkantā, cha uposathā avasiṭṭhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: surpassing; transcending; going beyond; overcoming; lit. going past (of)
Meaning in native language: превозмогание; переступание; выход за пределы; преодоление; досл. проход мимо
Example2: dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ, dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ, ariyañ’c’aṭṭh’aṅgikaṃ maggaṃ, dukkh’ūpasama-gāminaṃ.
English chant 2: Going to True and False Refuges

Meaning IN CONTEXT: transcends; overcomes; goes beyond; crosses over
Example1:
kodhaṃ jahe vippajaheyya mānaṃ, saṃyojanaṃ sabbam'atikkameyya,
taṃ nāmarūpasmim'asajjamānaṃ, akiñcanaṃ n'ānupatanti dukkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: could be overcome; could be surpassed; (comm) could be hurt or struck; lit. to be gone beyond
Meaning in native language: можно побороть; можно превзойти; (комм) можно ранить или ударить; досл. за пределы которого можно выйти
Commentary: (SNa) atikkamitabban'ti viheṭhetabbaṃ ghaṭṭetabbaṃ.
Example1: yo evarūpaṃ purisanāgaṃ purisasīhaṃ purisaājānīyaṃ purisanisabhaṃ purisadhorayhaṃ purisadantaṃ atikkamitabbaṃ maññeyya kim'aññatra adassanā'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having overstepped; having gone beyond; having crossed over
Example1: n’āhaṃ taṃ pamāṇaṃ atikkamitvā rajjan’ādivasena uppajjituṃ dassāmī’ti evam’ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: surpassing; overcoming; going beyond
Meaning in native language: превосходя; преодолевая; выходя за; проходя за
Example1: ubhatobhāgavimutto - idha ekacco puggalo ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: missing; going past
Example1: seyyathā’pi puriso sār’atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm’eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: exceeding; going over; lit. causing to go beyond
Meaning in native language: превышающий; входящий за пределы; досл. приводящий к выходу за рамки
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine das’āha-paramaṃ atireka-cīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: exceeds; goes over; lit. causes to go beyond
Meaning in native language: превосходит; превышает; досл. побуждает выйти за рамки
Example1: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthu-desanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu rañño, khattiyassa muddh’ābhisittassa, anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito, indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: spent; shot (from a bow); lit. over-exhausted
Meaning in native language: потраченный; который выпустили (из лука); досл. пере-израсходованный
Example1:
acaritvā brahmacariyaṃ, aladdhā yobbane dhanaṃ,
senti cāpa-atikhīṇā'va, purāṇāni anutthunaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: overcome; surmounted; crossed; gone past
Example1:
pañca chinde pañca jahe, pañca c'uttari bhāvaye,
pañca saṅga-atigo bhikkhu, oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too long; so long; for such a long time
Meaning in native language: слишком долго; так долго; в течение длительного времени
Example1: api ca kho me aticiraṃ anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato kāyo kilameyya. kāye kilante cittaṃ ūhaññeyya. ūhate citte ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: beyond; longer; more than usual; exceeding
Meaning in native language: вовне; дольше; более чем обычно; превышая
Example1:
appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ, oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati, atha kho so jarasāpi miyyati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not satisfied; discontent
Example1:
pupphāni h'eva pacinantaṃ, byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
atittaññ'eva kāmesu, antako kurute vasaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who uses too many requisites; who indulges oneself too much
Meaning in native language: злоупотребляющий необходимыми вещами; слишком потакающий себе
Commentary: (DHPa) dhonā vuccati cattāro paccaye, idam'atthaṃ ete'ti paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjanapaññā, taṃ atikkamitvā caranto atidhonacārī nāma
Example1:
ayasā’va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ, tat’uṭṭhāya tam’eva khādati.
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ, sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of time) passes; spends
Example1: so tāya dhamma-pariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n’ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyatti-bahulo, no dhammavihārī

Meaning IN CONTEXT: slaying; killing; lit. causing to fall
Meaning in native language: убийство; лишение жизни; досл. вызов падения
Example2: pāṇ’ātipātā veramaṇī, adinn’ādānā veramaṇī, kāmesu-micchācārā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammā-kammanto.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: shoots past; flies past; lit. causes to fly past
Meaning in native language: стреляет (в сторону); выпускает (по); досл. побуждает перелететь
Commentary: (SNa) atipāteyyā'ti atikkameyya. yāvatā so tālacchāyaṃ atikkameyya, tāvatā kālena ekacakkavāḷaṃ atikkamāmī'ti attano javasampattiṃ dasseti.
Example1: tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: destroys; kills; lit. causes to fall
Example1:
yo pāṇam’atipāteti, musā-vādañ’ca bhāsati.
loke adinnam’ādiyati, paradārañ’ca gacchati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too early
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too early in the morning; so early
Example1: satthā madhurassaraṃ nicchāretvā, kiṃ nu kho, mahārāja, atippag’eva āgatosī’ti āha

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too early (to); very early
Example1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etad’ahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten’upasaṅkameyyāmā’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: despises; scorns; looks down (on); has contempt (for); is condescending (to)
Meaning in native language: презирает; ни во что не ставит; смотрит вниз (на); относится снисходительно (к)
Example1:
kalyāṇaṃ vata bho sakkhi, attānaṃ atimaññasi,
yo santaṃ attani pāpaṃ, attānaṃ parigūhasi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: maddened; highly deluded
Meaning in native language: сведенный с ума; введенный в заблуждение
Example2: nāḷāgiriṃ gaja-varaṃ atimatta-bhūtaṃ, dāv’aggi-cakkam’asanī’va, sudāruṇan’taṃ, mett’ambu-seka-vidhinā jitavā mun’indo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: arrogance; pride; haughtiness; self-importance
Meaning in native language: высокомерие; гордость; надменность; чувство собственной значимости
Notes: also a hint of √mā to measure
Example1:
sātiyesu anassāvī, atimāne ca no yuto,
saṇho ca paṭibhānavā, na saddho na virajjati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: proud; conceited; arrogant
Example1: atimānissa purisapuggalassa anatimāno hoti parinibbānāya. dubbacassa purisapuggalassa sovacassatā hoti parinibbānāya.
Example2:
karaṇīyam’attha-kusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca:
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c’assa mudu, an-atimānī.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: asking too much; over-begging; lit. state of over begging
Meaning in native language: просить большая просьба; излишнее выпрашивание; досл. состояние чрезмерного выпрашивания
Example1:
na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigīse, desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena, adassanaṃ'y'eva tad'ajjhagamā’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who does not talk about vulgar topics; lit. not animal talker
Meaning in native language: кто не говорит на пошлые темы; досл. не ведущий животный разговор
Example1: saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: surplus robe; excess robe-cloth; extra robe
Meaning in native language: излишнее одеяние; избыточная ткань для одежды; дополнительное одеяние
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.1) atirekacīvaraṃ nāma anadhiṭṭhitaṃ avikappitaṃ.
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine das’āha-paramaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: extra bowl
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.21) atirekapatto nāma anadhiṭṭhito avikappito.
Example1: das’āhaparamaṃ atirekapatto dhāretabbo. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: more (than); superior; higher
Example2: mār’ātirekam’abhiyujjhita-sabba-rattiṃ, ghoram’pan’āḷavakam’akkhama-thaddha-yakkhaṃ, khantī-sudanta-vidhinā jitavā mun’indo.
Example3: yāvatikā ca bhikkhū kammappattā saṅgh'uposath'ārahā cattāro vā tato vā atirekā pakatattā pārājikaṃ anāpannā saṅghena vā anukkhittā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: surplus; excess; leftover; extra; more than
Meaning in native language: излишний; избыточный; оставшийся; дополнительный; больший чем
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine das’āha-paramaṃ atireka-cīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: das’āhaparamaṃ atireka-patto dhāretabbo. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: outshines; dazzles; illuminates; lit. very shines
Meaning in native language: затмевает; ослепляет; озаряет; досл. светит слишком
Example1:
evaṃ saṅkārabhūtesu, andhabhūte puthujjane,
atirocati paññāya, sammāsambuddhasāvako.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too late (in the day); late at night
Meaning in native language: слишком поздно (в течение дня); поздно ночью
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: overestimated; overstepped; exceeded; gone too far
Example1:
atisāra-diṭṭhiyā'va so samatto, mānena matto paripuṇṇamānī,
sayam'eva sāmaṃ manas'ābhisitto, diṭṭhī hi sā tassa tathā samattā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: overstepping; overshooting; overturning; denial
Notes: atisāra is the equivalent noun of the verb atidhāvati
Example1: janapadaniruttiṃ n’ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n’ātidhāveyyā’ti, iti kho pan’etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ’c’etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ’ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having passed over; having overlooked
Example1: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarā-dhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva {na} atisitvā, aham’pi kho’mhi jarā-dhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Example2: evaṃ-sampadam’idaṃ āyasmantānaṃ satthari sammukhībhūte, taṃ bhagavantaṃ atisitvā, amhe etam’atthaṃ paṭipucchitabbaṃ maññatha.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too loose; too slack; too flat
Meaning in native language: слишком свободный; плохо натянутый; слишком вялый
Commentary: (ANa) atisithilāti mandamucchanā.
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo atisithilā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: slack energy; too lax effort; half-hearted exertion
Meaning in native language: слабая энергия; слишком расслабленное усердие; вялое усилие
Commentary: (ANa) atilīnan’ti atisithilaṃ.
Example1: evam'evaṃ kho, soṇa, accāraddhavīriyaṃ uddhaccāya saṃvattati, atisithilavīriyaṃ kosajjāya saṃvattati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too cold
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: goes beyond; escapes; transcends; overcomes
Example1: yā evarūpā upekkhā, dhammaṃ sā ativattati. tasmā sā upekkhā nekkhammasitā'ti vuccati. imā cha nekkhammasitā upekkhā. chattiṃsa sattapadā veditabbā'ti, iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: dependent (upon); under the control (of)
Example1:
mam’eva kata maññantu, gihī-pabbajitā ubho,
mam’ev’ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: abuse; blame; verbal assault
Example1:
ahaṃ nāgo'va saṅgāme, cāpato patitaṃ saraṃ,
ativākyaṃ titikkhissaṃ, dussīlo hi bahujjano.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: thoroughly penetrating; completely seeing through
Example1: chandajāto ussahati, ussāhetvā tuleti, tulayitvā padahati, pahit’atto samāno kāyena c’eva parama-saccaṃ sacchikaroti, paññāya ca naṃ ativijjha passati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: too much; very; extremely; exceedingly; lit. like too much
Example2: sabbo panāyaṃ piṇḍapāto a’jigucchanīyo, imaṃ pūti-kāyaṃ patvā ativiya jigucchanīyo jāyati

Meaning IN CONTEXT: excessively; too long; too much; lit. over the limit
Meaning in native language: чрезмерно; слишком много; слишком долго; досл. больше предела
Example1: ‘asatī kir’āyaṃ, bho, vīṇā nāma, yath’evaṃ yaṃ kiñci vīṇā nāma ettha ca pan’āyaṃ jano ativelaṃ pamatto palaḷito’ti.
Example2: “idha, bhante, aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in the past; previously
Example1: ‘ahosiṃ nu kho ahaṃ atītam’addhānaṃ? na nu kho ahosiṃ atītam’addhānaṃ? kiṃ nu kho ahosiṃ atītam’addhānaṃ?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: regret about the past; bemoaning the past
Example1:
anāgatappajappāya,
atītass'ānusocanā,
etena bālā sussanti,
naḷo'va harito luto'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in the past; previously; lit. past time
Meaning in native language: в прошлом; ранее; досл. прошедшее время
Example1: atītaṃ vā, bhikkhave, addhānaṃ ārabbha kathaṃ katheyya, evaṃ ahosi atītam'addhānan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: past; gone past
Example1: pubbe vā paṭiladdha-pubbaṃ atītaṃ niruddhaṃ vipariṇataṃ samanussarato uppajjati somanassaṃ. yaṃ evarūpaṃ somanassaṃ idaṃ vuccati gehasitaṃ somanassaṃ.
Example2:
ye ca atītā sambuddhā, ye ca buddhā anāgatā.
yo c’eta’r’ahi sambuddho, bahunnaṃ soka-nāsano.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: past
Example1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etad’avoca, atītaṃ kho, āvuso, eko anto, anāgataṃ dutiyo anto, paccuppannaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
Example2:
atītaṃ n'ānvāgameyya,
nappaṭikaṅkhe anāgataṃ,
yad'atītam'pahīnan'taṃ,
appattañ'ca anāgataṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: transgressed; overstepped; lit. gone past
Example1:
ekaṃ dhammaṃ atītassa, musāvādissa jantuno,
vitiṇṇaparalokassa, n'atthi pāpaṃ akāriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: past, future and present
Example1: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atītān’āgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu
Example2: 'tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt’ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā
English chant 2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in the past and in the future
Example1: “iminā tvaṃ dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atīt’ānāgate nayaṃ nehi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: very; exceedingly; extremely
Example1:
purato pacchato vā’pi, aparo ce na vijjati,
atīva phāsu bhavati, ekassa vasato vane.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: personal name; lit. immeasurable; uncountable
Example1:
porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: from here; from this; because of this
Commentary: (SNa) ato'ti ato nibbānato.
Example1:
yattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
ato sarā nivattanti,
ettha vaṭṭaṃ na vattati

Meaning IN CONTEXT: ministering to oneself with sex; attending to one's sexual pleasure; taking care of one's sexual needs
Meaning in native language: прислуживание личным сексуальным удовольствиям; забота о личных сексуальных потребностях
Commentary: (VINa) attakāmapāricariyāyā'ti methunadhammasaṅkhātena kāmena pāricariyā kāmapāricariyā. attano atthāya kāmapāricariyā attakāmapāricariyā
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who wants self-liberation; desiring one's own good; lit. wanting for self
Meaning in native language: желающий освобождения для себя; стремящийся к собственному благу; досл. желающий для себя
Example2:
tasmā hi attakāmena, mahattam’abhikaṅkhatā.
saddhammo garu-kātabbo, saraṃ buddhāna sāsanan”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one's own lust; sense-pleasures for oneself
Meaning in native language: собственное вожделение; чувственное удовольствие для себя
Commentary: (VIN 1.2.4) attakāman'ti attano kāmaṃ attano hetuṃ attano adhippāyaṃ attano pāricariyaṃ.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmassa santike attakāma-pāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self-mortification; self-torture; lit. self tiring
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ attakilamath’ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: practice of self-mortification
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ attakilamath’ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who criticises oneself; who blames oneself
Meaning in native language: тот кто себя критикует; кто осуждает себя
Example1:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yad'attagarahī tad'akubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self-restrained; self-guarded
Commentary: (DHPa) so'ti so tvaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ sante attanā'va guttatāya attagutto.
Example1:
attanā coday'attānaṃ, paṭimaṃsetha attanā,
so attagutto satimā, sukhaṃ bhikkhu vihāhisi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self-destruction; self-annihilation
Example1:
yo sāsanaṃ arahataṃ, ariyānaṃ dhammajīvinaṃ,
paṭikkosati dummedho, diṭṭhiṃ nissāya pāpikaṃ,
phalāni kaṭṭhakass'eva, attaghātāya phallati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self-created; self-originated; lit. born from oneself
Meaning in native language: само-созданный; возникший из-за себя; досл. рожденный из себя
Example1:
attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ, attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ,
abhimatthati dummedhaṃ, vajiraṃ'v'asmamayaṃ maṇiṃ.

Grammar: adv, masc abl sg, atta group
Meaning IN CONTEXT: as oneself; as self
Example1: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ; na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: personal benefit; personal profit
Example1: uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, att’attham’pi tasmiṃ samaye yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati, par’attham’pi tasmiṃ samaye yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati
Example2: evaṃ hi vo bhikkhave sikkhitabbaṃ. att’atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam’eva appamādena sampādetuṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: armed; violent; fighting; lit. taken stick
Meaning in native language: вооруженный; жестокий; дерущийся; досл. взятая палка
Example1:
aviruddhaṃ viruddhesu, attadaṇḍesu nibbutaṃ,
sādānesu anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one's own welfare; personal benefit; personal profit
Example1:
atta’d’atthaṃ par’atthena, bahunā’pi na hāpaye,
atta’d’attham’abhiññāya, sadattha-pasuto siyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self controlled; self restrained
Commentary: (ANa) attadantan'ti attanāyeva dantaṃ, na aññehi damathaṃ upanītaṃ.
Example1:
varam’assatarā dantā, ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā, attadanto tato varaṃ.
Example2:
attā have jitaṃ seyyo, yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.
attadantassa posassa, niccaṃ saññatacārino.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self-reliant; independent; oneself as foundation; lit. own island; (or) own lamp
Meaning in native language: самодостаточный; независимый; опирающийся на себя; досл. свой остров; (или) свой светильник
Example2: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self; himself; herself; itself; yourself; oneself (object)
Example1:
hananti bhogā dummedhaṃ, no ca pāragavesino,
bhogataṇhāya dummedho, hanti aññ'eva attanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: with oneself; by self
Example1:
caranti bālā dummedhā, amitten'eva attanā,
karontā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, yaṃ hoti kaṭukapphalaṃ.
Example2: adinn’ādānaṃ pahāya adinn’ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn’ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: just by oneself for oneself; by oneself to oneself
Meaning in native language: лишь сам для себя; сам себе
Example1: taṃ kut’ettha labbhā, yaṃ me paro anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyya. yaṃnūn’āhaṃ attanā’va attano anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyyan”ti.
Example2: kiñ’c’āpi te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ — ‘piyo no attā’ti, atha kho tesaṃ appiyo attā. taṃ kissa hetu? yañ’hi appiyo appiyassa kareyya, taṃ te attanā’va attano karonti; tasmā tesaṃ appiyo attā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: by oneself about oneself; lit. just by oneself self
Meaning in native language: собой о себе; сам себя; досл. только собой себя
Example1: ‘atthi me attā’ti vā assa saccato thetato diṭṭhi uppajjati; ‘n'atthi me attā’ti vā assa saccato thetato diṭṭhi uppajjati; ‘attanā'va attānaṃ sañjānāmī’ti vā assa saccato thetato diṭṭhi uppajjati
Example2: so ākaṅkhamāno attanā’va attānaṃ byākareyya - khīṇanirayo’mhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇa-pettivisayo khīṇ’āpāya-duggati-vinipāto sot’āpanno’ham’asmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhi-parāyaṇo’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: one's own; belonging to oneself
Example1: api nu tumhākaṃ evam’assa — ‘amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī’ti? “no hetaṃ, bhante”. “taṃ kissa hetu”? “na hi no etaṃ, bhante, attā vā attaniyaṃ vā”ti.
Example2: “yasmā ca kho, ānanda, suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suñño loko’ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in oneself; for oneself
Example1:
pakappitā saṅkhatā yassa dhammā, purakkhatā santi avīvadātā,
yad'attani passati ānisaṃsaṃ, taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.
Example2: bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan’āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār’addhānamaggaṃ, ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati

Meaning IN CONTEXT: when self; when oneself
Example1: attani vā, bhikkhave, sati attaniyaṃ me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. attaniye vā, bhikkhave, sati attā me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in oneself; for oneself
Example1:
yad'attanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ, diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
tad'eva so tattha samuggahāya, nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: dogma about the self; belief in an (enduring) soul; concept of self
Meaning in native language: убеждение о самости; вера в (вечную) душу; концепция 'я'
Commentary: (KNa) attānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhaccā’ti sakkāyadiṭṭhiṃ uddharitvā.
Example1:
suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu, mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca, evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ, maccurājā na passatī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for oneself; for one's own sake; for one's own benefit
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni, agilāno, attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilānā attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for self; to oneself
Example1:
sukarāni asādhūni, attano ahitāni ca,
yaṃ ve hitañ’ca sādhuñ’ca, taṃ ve paramadukkaraṃ.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: of self; of oneself
Example1:
anupubbena medhāvī, thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe.
kammāro rajatass’eva, niddhame malam’attano.
Example2:
pamādo rajo pamādo, pamād’ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya, abbahe sallam’attano’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: harm for oneself; self-affliction
Example1: so ca kho attabyābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, para-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, ubhaya-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, paññā-nirodhiko vighāta-pakkhiko anibbāna-saṃvattaniko

Meaning IN CONTEXT: personal existence; individual being; lit. self existence
Example1: yaṃ kho kāmayamāno tajjaṃ tajjaṃ attabhāvaṃ abhinibbatteti puññabhāgiyaṃ vā apuññabhāgiyaṃ vā, ayaṃ vuccati kāmānaṃ vipāko.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: incarnation; existence; personal existence; lit. obtaining self becoming
Meaning in native language: воплощение; жизнь; личное существование; досл. обретение личного становления
Example1: ettako’pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n’atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath’eva ṭhassati.
Example2: idha, thera, yaṃ atītaṃ taṃ pahīnaṃ, yaṃ anāgataṃ taṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, paccuppannesu ca attabhāvapaṭilābhesu chandarāgo suppaṭivinīto.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: pleased; happy; delighted; satisfied; lit. own mind
Meaning in native language: довольный; счастливый; удовлетворенный; досл. свой ум
Example1: te tāvataken'eva attamanā assu — ‘alam'ettāvatā, katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttarikaraṇīyan’ti.
Example2: idam’avoca bhagavā. attamanā pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanduṃ.
English chant 2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Example3:
sace labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ, saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
abhibhuyya sabbāni parissayāni, careyya ten'attamano satīmā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: pleasure; delight; joyful mentality; lit. own mind state
Meaning in native language: довольство; наслаждение; восторг; досл. состояние своего ума
Example1: evam’eva kho cetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko, yato yato imassa dhammapariyāyassa paññāya atthaṃ upaparikkheyya, labheth’eva attamanataṃ, labheth’eva cetaso pasādaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: words of satisfaction; expression of happiness; exclamation of delight
Meaning in native language: слова удовлетворения; выражение счастья; восклицание восторга
Example1: so taṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya, pārupetvā attamano attamanavācaṃ nicchāreyya, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti!

Meaning IN CONTEXT: like (for) oneself; equal to oneself
Commentary: (SNa) yasmā pana attapemena samaṃ pemaṃ nāma n'atthi. mātāpit'ādayo hi chaḍḍetvā'pi puttadhīt'ādayo ca aposetvā'pi sattā attānam'eva posenti.
Example1:
n'atthi attasamaṃ pemaṃ,
n'atthi dhaññasamaṃ dhanaṃ,
n'atthi paññāsamā ābhā,
vuṭṭhi ve paramā sarā'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self-generated; produced by oneself
Example1:
attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ, attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ,
abhimatthati dummedhaṃ, vajiraṃ'v'asmamayaṃ maṇiṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: depending on oneself; one's own refuge; with oneself as a refuge
Meaning in native language: зависящий от себя; сам себе прибежище
Example2: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: theory; doctrine of self; self concept; sense of being
Meaning in native language: теория; учение о самости; идея о 'я'; само отождествление
Example2: kām’upādānaṃ, diṭṭh’upādānaṃ, sīlabbat’upādānaṃ, attavād’upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhā-paccayā upādānaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: grasping of theory of self; clinging to a self-concept; attachment to sense of being
Meaning in native language: привязанность к теории самости; цепляние к идеи о 'я'; цепляние к само отождествлению
Example2: kām’upādānaṃ, diṭṭh’upādānaṃ, sīlabbat’upādānaṃ, attavād’upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhā-paccayā upādānaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for one's own sake
Example1:
na attahetu na parassa hetu, na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano, sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
Example2: iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: accepting and rejecting; picking up and throwing down; acquiring and discarding
Meaning in native language: принятие и отвержение; собирание и отбрасывание; приобретение и оставление
Commentary: (NIDD1) attā'ti attānudiṭṭhi n'atthi. nirattā'ti ucchedadiṭṭhi n'atthi. attā'ti gahitaṃ n'atthi. nirattā'ti muñcitabbaṃ n'atthi.
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attaṃ nirattaṃ na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.
Example2:
na tassa puttā pasavo, khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati,
attaṃ vā'pi nirattaṃ vā, na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self; oneself
Example1: saṅkhārā ca h’idaṃ attā abhavissaṃsu, na’y’idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu — ‘evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesuṃ
Example2:
patirūpa-desa-vāso ca, pubbe ca katapuññatā.
atta-sammā-paṇidhi ca, etaṃ maṅgalam’uttamaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: taking up; accepting; seizing; grasping
Commentary: (NIDD1) attā'ti att’ānudiṭṭhi n'atthi ... attā'ti gahitaṃ n’atthi.
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attaṃ nirattaṃ na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.
Example2:
aviruddhaṃ viruddhesu, atta-daṇḍesu nibbutaṃ,
sādānesu anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: taken up; accepted; seized; grasped
Example1: aviruddhaṃ viruddhesu, atta-daṇḍesu nibbutaṃ, sādānesu anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Example2: atta-daṇḍā bhayaṃ jātaṃ, janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ, saṃvegaṃ kittayissāmi, yathā saṃvijitaṃ mayā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: the fact of taking oneself as an authority; putting oneself in charge
Meaning in native language: принятия себя как авторитета; возложение на себя ответственности
Commentary: (ANa) attānaṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā nibbattitaṃ guṇajātaṃ att'ādhipateyyaṃ.
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, ādhipateyyāni. katamāni tīṇi? att'ādhipateyyaṃ, lok'ādhipateyyaṃ, dhamm'ādhipateyyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having oneself as an authority; with oneself in charge
Meaning in native language: сам себе авторитет; ответственный перед собой
Commentary: (ANa) attādhipateyyako'ti attajeṭṭhako.
Example1:
passanti devā ca tathāgatā ca, lokasmiṃ bālaṃ visamaṃ carantaṃ,
tasmā hi att'ādhipateyyako ca, lok'ādhipo ca nipako ca jhāyī,
dhamm'ādhipo ca anudhammacārī, na hīyati saccaparakkamo muni.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: belonging to oneself; depending on one's own will
Example1: so aparena samayena tamhā dāsabyā mucceyya att'ādhīno apar'ādhīno

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self; himself; herself; itself; oneself (object)
Example1: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ; na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.
Example2: ahaṃ sukhito homi niddukkho homi avero homi abyāpajjho homi anīgho homi sukhī attānaṃ pariharāmi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: only oneself; just himself
Example1: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarā-dhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva {na} atisitvā, aham’pi kho’mhi jarā-dhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Example2: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: makes oneself unadmonishable; lit. makes oneself not to be spoken to
Meaning in native language: делает себя не наставляемым; досл. делает себя тем с кем не возможно говорить
Example1: bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti, uddesa-pariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: praises oneself (because of); exalts oneself (due to)
Example1: n'ev'attān'ukkaṃsissāma na paraṃ vambhissāmā'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sense of self; concept of identity; speculation about self; view that the self exists; lit. following view of self
Meaning in native language: ощущения себя; само отождествление; идея о 'я'; предположение о самости; идея что самость существует
Example1:
suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: devoted to one's own welfare; practising for one's own development; engaging in meditation
Meaning in native language: посвятивший себя собственному благополучию; практикующий для собственного развития; занимающийся медитацией
Commentary: (DHPa) pihet'attānuyoginan'ti tāya paṭipattiyā sāsanato cuto gihibhāvaṃ patvā pacchā ye attānuyogaṃ anuyuttā sīlādīni sampādetvā devamanussānaṃ santikā sakkāraṃ labhanti, tesaṃ piheti, aho vat'āham'pi evarūpo assan'ti icchatī'ti attho.
Example1:
ayoge yuñjam'attānaṃ, yogasmiñ'ca ayojayaṃ,
atthaṃ hitvā piyaggāhī, pihet'att'ānuyoginaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: self and no-self; personal or impersonal
Meaning in native language: я и не-я; личный или безличный
Commentary: (NIDD1) attā'ti attānudiṭṭhi n'atthi. nirattā'ti ucchedadiṭṭhi n'atthi. attā'ti gahitaṃ n'atthi. nirattā'ti muñcitabbaṃ n'atthi.
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.
Example2:
na tassa puttā pasavo, khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati,
attā vā'pi nirattā vā, na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: intended for oneself; designated for oneself; lit. pointing out oneself
Meaning in native language: предназначенный для себя; определенный себе; досл. указывающий на себя
Commentary:
(VIN 1.2.6) attuddesan'ti attano atthāya.
(VINa) attuddesan'ti, mayhaṃ esā'ti evaṃ attā uddeso assā'ti att'uddesā, taṃ att'uddesaṃ.
Example1: saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena, assāmikaṃ att’uddesaṃ, pamāṇikā kāretabbā. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ: dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: pertaining to oneself; concerning oneself; referring to oneself
Meaning in native language: свойственный себе; относящийся к себе; приписанный себе
Commentary: (VIN 1.1.4) att'upanāyikan'ti te vā kusale dhamme attani upaneti attānaṃ vā tesu kusalesu dhammesu upaneti.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, anabhijānaṃ, uttarimanussadhammaṃ att’ūpanāyikaṃ alam’ariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya: “iti jānāmi, iti passāmī”ti,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: well-wishing; benevolent; lit. desiring benefit
Meaning in native language: желающий благо; доброжелательный; досл. желающий пользы
Example1: ye vā pan’assa te honti atthakāmā hitakāmā phāsukakāmā yogakkhemakāmā mātā vā pitā vā bhātā vā bhaginī vā mittā vā amaccā vā ñātisālohitā vā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: disappearing; vanishing; settling down; subsiding; lit. going home
Example1: ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday’atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhaya-gāminiyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of sun) set; lit. gone home
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.22) atthaṅ'gate sūriye'ti oggate sūriye
Example1: sammato'pi ce bhikkhu atthaṅ'gate suriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: disappeared; gone; vanished; lit. gone home
Meaning in native language: исчезнувший; ушедший; пропавший; досл. ушедший восвояси
Example1: rūpaṃ kho, āvuso, aniccaṃ. yad'aniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ; yaṃ dukkhaṃ taṃ niruddhaṃ tad'atthaṅ'gataṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: after sunset; lit. when the sun has set
Meaning in native language: после захода солнца; досл. когда солнце село
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.22) atthaṅ'gate sūriye'ti oggate sūriye
Example1: sammato'pi ce bhikkhu atthaṅ'gate suriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: disappearance; vanishing; settling down; subsiding; lit. going home
Meaning in native language: исчезновение; пропадание; оседание; затихание; досл. уход восвояси
Example1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay’ānupassī viharati — ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅ’gamo
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: acting in the interest (of)
Example1:
taṃ ce hi n'āddakkhuṃ tathāvimuttaṃ,
devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā,
nar'uttamaṃ atthacaraṃ narānaṃ,
ye taṃ namassanti pasaṃsiyā te'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: thoughts intent on the goal; thinking of the meaning
Meaning in native language: мысленно направленный к цели; думающий о смысле
Example2:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddha-mānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, atthacintā vas’ānugā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who sees the goal; sees the truth
Meaning in native language: видящий смысл; видящий цель; кто видит истину
Example1:
pāpaṃ sahāyaṃ parivajjayetha, an-atthadassiṃ visame niviṭṭhaṃ.
sayaṃ na seve pasutaṃ pamattaṃ, eko care khagga-visāṇa-kappo.
Example2:
sabbhi’r’eva samāsetha, paṇḍiteh’atthadassibhi,
atthaṃ mahantaṃ gambhīraṃ, duddasaṃ nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ,
dhīrā samadhigacchanti, appamattā vicakkhaṇā’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not proud; not arrogant; lit. not stiff
Meaning in native language: не гордый; не высокомерный; досл. не застывший
Example2:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddha-mānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, attha-cintā vas’ānugā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not stubborn at heart; without being stubborn
Meaning in native language: не упрямый в душе; без упрямства
Example2:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddhamānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, attha-cintā vas’ānugā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: flexibility; non-stubbornness; easygoingness; lit. non-stiffness
Example1: māyāvissa purisapuggalassa amāyā hoti parinibbānāya. thaddhassa purisapuggalassa atthaddhiyaṃ hoti parinibbānāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: beneficial saying; profitable verse
Example1:
sahassam'api ce vācā, anatthapada-saṃhitā,
ekaṃ atthapadaṃ seyyo, yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: to learn the meaning (of); to understand the meaning (of)
Example1: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, bhante, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: profitable; meaningful; beneficial; lit. connected with good
Example1: yañ’ca kho jaññā rahovādaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ tatra kālaññū assa tassa rahovādassa vacanāya.
Example2: samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: to convey a meaning; to make a point; lit. for the communication of a meaning
Meaning in native language: чтобы донести смысл; чтобы научить; досл. для передачи смысла
Example1: upamā kho my’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, katā atthassa viññāpanāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: full of meaning; significant; relevant; lit. having meaning quality
Meaning in native language: полный смысла; значительный; уместный; досл. имеющий качество значимости
Commentary:
(SNa) atthavatī'ti, atthavatiyo.
(SNt) atthavatiyo'ti lokiya-lok'uttar'āttha-saṅgahitā lokiya-kusala-lok'uttaramagga-saṅgaṇhanato.
Example1:
idh'āgamā vijjupabhāsavaṇṇā,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā,
buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca namassamānā,
gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: benefit; advantage
Example1:
etam'atthavasaṃ ñatvā, paṇḍito sīlasaṃvuto,
nibbānagamanaṃ maggaṃ, khippam'eva visodhaye.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sensible; rational; lit. intent on benefit
Meaning in native language: благоразумный; рациональный; досл. стремящийся к благу
Example1: tañ'ca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, kulaputtā upenti atthavasikā, atthavasaṃ paṭicca; n'eva rāj'ābhinītā, na cor'ābhinītā, na iṇ'aṭṭā, na bhay'aṭṭā, na ājīvikāpakatā;

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who speaks what is beneficial; who says what is meaningful
Meaning in native language: кто говорит благо; кто говорит полное смысла
Example3: samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for the purpose of; for the sake of
Example1: atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati saṃvar’atthaṃ pahān’atthaṃ virāg’atthaṃ nirodh’atthan”ti.
Example2: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevāmi yāva’d’eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt’ātapa-siriṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva’d’eva utuparissaya-vinodanaṃ paṭisallān’ārām’atthaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: achieves one's purpose; attains one's goal; fulfils one's need; lit. experiences the benefit
Meaning in native language: достигает своей цели; реализует свое намерение; удовлетворяет свою потребность; досл. ощущает пользу
Example1: “yaṃ kho tumhe, āyasmanto, bhikkhuṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇittha na taṃ tassa bhikkhuno kiñci atthaṃ anubhoti: yuñjant'āyasmanto sakaṃ, mā vo sakaṃ vinassā”ti.
Example2: yassa kassaci piḷandhanavikatiyā ākaṅkhati, yadi muddikāya yadi kuṇḍalāya yadi gīveyyakāya yadi suvaṇṇamālāya, tañ'c'assa atthaṃ anubhoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: disappears; dissolves; vanishes; lit. goes home
Meaning in native language: исчезает; растворяется; пропадает; досл. уходит восвояси
Example1:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ, ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: meaning; significance
Example1: imassa nu kho, bhante, bhagavatā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo’ti?
Example2: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ s’ātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
Example3: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: benefit; profit; good; welfare; goal
Example2:
karaṇīyam’attha-kusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca:
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c’assa mudu, anatimānī.
Example3: ubhay’atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam’eva appamādena sampādetun'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: use; function; purpose
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim’atthiyo ādāso”ti? “paccavekkhaṇ’attho, bhante”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: matter; affair; case
Example1: evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhay’attha kaliggaho
Example2:
na tena hoti dhammaṭṭho, yen'atthaṃ sāhasā naye,
yo ca atthaṃ anatthañ'ca, ubho niccheyya paṇḍito.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: need (for); want (for)
Example1: “attho me, āvuso, cīvarenā”ti. dvattikkhattuṃ codayamāno sārayamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ.
Example3:
atthamhi jātamhi sukhā sahāyā, tuṭṭhī sukhā yā itarītarena,
puññaṃ sukhaṃ jīvitasaṅkhayamhi, sabbassa dukkhassa sukhaṃ pahānaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: needing; wanting
Example1:
taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddaṃ vo, yāvant'ettha samāgatā,
taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha, usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va, māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: home; rest; shelter
Example1:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ, ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: you (all) must be; may you (all) be
Meaning in native language: вы должны быть; да будете вы
Example3: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād’attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for the good; the benefit and the happiness (of)
Example2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok’ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for the purpose (of); for the sake (of); for the benefit (of)
Example1: “yassa khv’āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno. handa dāni paṭisaṃharāmi”
Example2: bhikkhugaṇanā nāma imasmiṃ uposath'agge uposath'atthāya sannipatitā bhikkhū ettakā'ti, bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fortunate (for); beneficial (for); useful (for); lit. for the benefit (of)
Meaning in native language: благоприятный (для); благотворный (для); полезный (для); досл. для блага
Example2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok’ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: there is, friend; there is, brother
Example1: kahaṃ pana, bhikkhu, eta'r'ahi so bhagavā viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho'ti. atth'āvuso, uttaresu janapadesu sāvatthi nāma nagaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: wanting; needing; desiring; seeking
Example1: ārocayāmi vo, bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo, bhikkhave — ‘mā vo sāmaññ’atthikānaṃ sataṃ sāmaññ’attho parihāyi, sati uttariṃ karaṇīye’.
Example2:
yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath’etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ’ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: existence; idea of existence; fact of being present; lit. is state
Meaning in native language: существование; идея существования; факт присутствия; досл. состояние быть
Example1: idāni pana sūriy’ālokassa atthitāya padīpakiccaṃ idha natthi.
Example2: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: existence; the fact of being present
Example1: rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī’ti kilesassa atthibhāven’eva pana rūparāgaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ karoti nāma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for purpose (of); for use (of)
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: there is
Example2:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena,
Example3: ‘atthi kāyo’ti vā pana’ssa sati paccupaṭṭhitā hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: there are; they are
Example1:
ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti, idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi, vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.
Example3:
ye keci pāṇabhūtā-atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā y'eva mahantā vā, majjhimā rassakā aṇukathūlā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: seeker; who wants; who needs; who desires
Meaning in native language: ищущий; кто хочет; у кого есть надобность; кто желает
Example1:
evaṃ abhikkanta-dassāviṃ, atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kathaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ, maccurājā na passati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: may it be! may there be!
Meaning in native language: да будет это! этому следует быть
Example1: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n’eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam’eva alattha

Meaning IN CONTEXT: there is even
Example1: rañño'pi kho, bhikkhave, pasenadissa kosalassa atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not proud; not arrogant; lit. not stiff
Meaning in native language: не гордый; не высокомерный; досл. не застывший
Example1: arahante sītībhūte, katakicce anāsave nihacca mānaṃ athaddho, te namasse anuttare”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: then his; as his
Example1:
yadā dvayesu dhammesu, pāragū hoti brāhmaṇo,
ath'assa sabbe saṃyogā, atthaṃ gacchanti jānato.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: then; and then; after that
Example1: dandho, ānanda, udaka-phusitānaṃ nipāto, atha kho naṃ khippam’eva parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya;
Example2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta-vaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami
Example3: atha kho āyasmā tisso bhagavato pitucchāputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: yet; and yet; but; but still; however; even then
Meaning in native language: но; и все же; однако; не смотря на это
Example1: atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati saṃvar’atthaṃ pahān’atthaṃ virāg’atthaṃ nirodh’atthan”ti.
Example2: kiñ’c’āpi te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ — ‘piyo no attā’ti, atha kho tesaṃ appiyo attā. taṃ kissa hetu? yañ’hi appiyo appiyassa kareyya, taṃ te attanā’va attano karonti; tasmā tesaṃ appiyo attā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: and yet; but still
Meaning in native language: и кроме того; но все же
Example1: kicchaṃ vat’āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca pan’imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa

Meaning IN CONTEXT: but if; and if; so if
Meaning in native language: но если; и если; так что если
Example1:
parassa ce hi vacasā nihīno, tumo sahā hoti nihīnapañño,
atha ce sayaṃ vedagū hoti dhīro, na koci bālo samaṇesu atthi.
Example2:
akkodhano vigatakhilo'ham'asmi, anutīre mahiy'ekarattivāso,
vivaṭā kuṭi nibbuto gini, atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: or
Example1:
sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti, na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena, na ucc’āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: and; then; and also
Example2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta-vaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami
Example3:
“sabbe dhammā anattā”ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: but; rather; even
Example1:
appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino,
atha-ayaṃ itarā pajā, tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.
Example2:
atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho, aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: then; after that; and what is more
Meaning in native language: тогда; после этого; и более того
Example1: idam'avoca bhagavā. idaṃ vatvāna sugato ath'āparaṃ etad'avoca satthā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: and even
Example2:
sabbe saddhamma-garuno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca.
athā'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: but then; but now; but after
Meaning in native language: но потом; но сейчас; но после
Example1:
paṇḍito'ti samaññāto, ekacariyaṃ adhiṭṭhito,
athā'pi methune yutto, mando'va parikissati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: but this; then this; and this
Meaning in native language: но это; потом этот; и это
Example1: yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.
Example2:
appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino.
ath’āyaṃ itarā pajā, tīram’ev’ānudhāvati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: then I
Example1: sace kho pana atthi paro loko, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, ath'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmī'ti
Example2: ath'āhaṃ bhikkhave sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: then here; in this regard
Meaning in native language: тогда здесь; в связи с этим
Example1: tiṭṭhanti kho pana, bhikkhave, tatth’eva pañc’indriyāni. ath’ettha sutavato ariyasāvakassa avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not stealing
Example2: adinn’ādānaṃ pahāya adinn’ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn’ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: and then; after that; because of
Example1:
byādhidhammā jarādhammā, atho maraṇadhammino.
yathā dhammā tathā sattā, jigucchanti puthujjanā.
Example2:
yān’īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe.
sabb’eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.
Example3: mātari pitari c’āpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye catutthamhi, tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: and too; and even
Example1:
vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke, atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,

Example2:
yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe,
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: eating; feeding on
Example1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unarmed; peaceful; lit. without a stick
Example1:
yo daṇḍena adaṇḍesu, appaduṭṭhesu dussati,
dasannam'aññataraṃ ṭhānaṃ, khippam'eva nigacchati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-violently; peacefully; lit. without a stick
Example1: so imaṃ pathaviṃ sāgarapariyantaṃ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having not caused; having not allowed (to happen); lit. having not given (a chance)
Meaning in native language: не вызвав; не допустив (произойти); досл. не дав (возможность)
Example1: yathā āvajjanaṃ na rajjati, na dussati, na muyhati, evaṃ rajjan’ādivasena ca uppajjituṃ adatvā āvajjanappamāṇen’eva cittaṃ ṭhapessāmī’ti ayam’ettha attho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not giving; not bestowing
Example1:
‘yācako appiyo hoti, yācaṃ adadam’appiyo.
tasm’āhaṃ taṃ na yācāmi, mā me videssanā ahū’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: untamed; untrained; wild
Example1: so vata, cunda, attanā adanto avinīto aparinibbuto paraṃ damessati vinessati parinibbāpessatī’ti n’etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: uncompassionate; unkind; merciless; cruel
Example1: kathañ'ca, cunda, tividhaṃ kāyena asoceyyaṃ hoti? idha, cunda, ekacco pāṇ'ātipātī hoti luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho aday'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtesu

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not wishing to see; wanting to not see
Meaning in native language: не желающий видеть; желающий не видеть
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa; so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: out of sight (of); disappearance (of); invisibility
Example1:
pheṇ'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā, marīcidhammaṃ abhisambudhāno,
chetvāna mārassa papupphakāni, adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche.
Example2:
na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigiṃse, desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena, adassanaṃ'y'eva tad'ajjhagamā’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: absence (of); lit. not seeing (of)

sāhu dassanam'ariyānaṃ, sannivāso sadā sukho,
adassanena bālānaṃ, niccam'eva sukhī siyā.
Example2:

piyānaṃ adassanaṃ dukkhaṃ, appiyānañ'ca dassanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: absence of seeing; not understanding
Example1: ‘hīno’ham’asmī’ti vā samanupassanti; kim’aññatra yathābhūtassa adassanā?
Example2: yo evarūpaṃ purisanāgaṃ purisasīhaṃ purisaājānīyaṃ purisanisabhaṃ purisadhorayhaṃ purisadantaṃ atikkamitabbaṃ maññeyya kim'aññatra adassanā'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has no regard (for); lit. who has not seeing
Meaning in native language: кто не уважает; досл. кто не видел
Example1: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having not caused to give (to); having not had given (to)
Meaning in native language: не побудив дать; не заставив дать
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.42) adāpetvā'ti na kiñci dāpetvā.
Example1: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya: “gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī”ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gave
Example1:
migaluddo pure āsiṃ, araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ, tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.
Example2: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam’anussaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not seen
Meaning in native language: который не был виден; не увиденный
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?
Example2:
diṭṭhā vā ye ca adiṭṭhā, ye сa dūre vasanti avidūre
bhūtā vā sambhav’esī vā, sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit’attā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: never seen before
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who speaks about the unseen (as); who states what one has not seen (as)
Example1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, ariyavohārā. katame aṭṭha? adiṭṭhe adiṭṭhavāditā, asute asutavāditā, amute amutavāditā, aviññāte aviññātavāditā, diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā, sute sutavāditā, mute mutavāditā, viññāte viññātavāditā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without view; no belief
Example1:
na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbatenā'pi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not given; not offered
Example1:
yo pāṇam’atipāteti, musā-vādañ’ca bhāsati.
loke adinnam’ādiyati, paradārañ’ca gacchati.
Example2: pāṇ’ātipātā veramaṇī, adinn’ādānā veramaṇī, kāmesu-micchācārā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammā-kammanto.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: takes something which is not given
Meaning in native language: берет то что не было дано
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: taking something which is not given
Meaning in native language: берущий то что не было дано
Example1: “coro'si, bālo'si, mūḷho'si, theno'sī”ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: theft; stealing; lit. taking what is not given
Meaning in native language: кража; воровство; досл. взятие того что не дано
Example2: pāṇ’ātipātā veramaṇī, adinn’ādānā veramaṇī, kāmesu-micchācārā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammā-kammanto.
Example3: adinn’ādānaṃ pahāya adinn’ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn’ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who steals; who takes what is not offered
Meaning in native language: кто ворует; кто берет то что не дано
Example1: adinnādāyissa purisapuggalassa adinnādānā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya. abrahmacārissa purisapuggalassa abrahmacariyā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: that; such; so and so
Meaning in native language: тот; такой; такой то и такой то
Example1: “no h’idaṃ”. “taṃ kissa hetu”? “aduñ’hi allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, tañ’ca pana udake nikkhittaṃ. yāva’d’eva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti.
Example2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unafflicted; free from trouble; without suffering
Meaning in native language: не пораженный; свободный от затруднений; без страданий
Example1: sabbe te adukkhā anupaghātā anupāyāsā apariḷāhā sammāpaṭipannā’ti — iti vadaṃ itth’eke ussādeti.
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: neutral; neither pleasant nor unpleasant; neither comfortable nor uncomfortable
Example1: sukham’pi vedayati, dukkham’pi vedayati, adukkham’asukham’pi vedayati. vedayatī’ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā ‘vedanā’ti vuccati.
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
Example3: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: this is neutral; this is neither pleasant nor unpleasant
Meaning in native language: это нейтрально; это ни приятно, ни неприятно
Example1: kiñ'ca vijānāti? sukhan'ti'pi vijānāti, dukkhan'ti'pi vijānāti, adukkham'asukhan'ti'pi vijānāti. vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇanti vuccatī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: neutral; lit. to be felt as neither pain nor pleasure
Meaning in native language: нейтральный; досл. может быть ощутим ни как боль, ни как удовольствие
Example1: adukkham'asukhavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhu, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati adukkham'asukhā vedanā. so adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: such indeed
Example1: “no h’idaṃ”. “taṃ kissa hetu”? “aduñ’hi allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, tañ’ca pana udake nikkhittaṃ. yāva’d’eva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti.
Example2: no h'etaṃ, bhante. taṃ kissa hetu'? aduñ'hi, bhante, vantaṃ paṭikūlasammatan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: loving; kind; not angry; not offended
Example1: yad'api, bhikkhave, adoso tad’api kusala-mūlaṃ; yad’api aduṭṭho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tad’api kusalaṃ
Example2:
ekam’pi ce pāṇam’aduṭṭha-citto, mettāyati kusalī tena hoti.
sabbe ca pāṇe manas’ānukampī, pahūtam’ariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: with benevolent mind; lit. not angry mind
Meaning in native language: с доброжелательным умом; досл. с умом без злобы
Example1:
ekam’pi ce pāṇam’aduṭṭhacitto, mettāyati kusalī tena hoti.
sabbe ca pāṇe manas’ānukampī, pahūtam’ariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: taught; explained
Example2: vana-ppagumbe yathā phussit’agge, gimhāna-māse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath’ūpamaṃ dhamma-varaṃ adesayi, nibbāna-gāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-hatred; kindness

Example1:

adukkham’asukhaṃ santaṃ, addakkhi naṃ aniccato.

Meaning in native language: способен выдержать путешествие; досл. терпеливый к путешествию

Example1: addhānakkhamo hoti, padhānakkhamo hoti, app'ābādho hoti, asitaṃ pītaṃ khāyitaṃ sāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati, caṅkam'ādhigato samādhi ciraṭṭhitiko hoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca caṅkame ānisaṃsā'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: taking a journey; going travelling

Example1: gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv’ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo.

Example2: bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan’āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār’addhānamaggaṃ, ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati

adhammo nirayaṃ neti, dhammo pāpeti suggatiṃ.

Example2: yatv’ādhikaraṇam’enaṃ cakkhu’ndriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ, tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjāhi;

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (vinaya) issue; legal process; law-suit; litigation

Meaning IN CONTEXT: controversial point; reason for dispute
Meaning in native language: спорный вопрос; пункт что является основой для разногласий

Example2: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

Meaning in native language: владеет; обладает; получает; досл. полностью приобретает

appamatto ubho atthe, adhiggaṇhāti paṇḍito.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: what one has practised; what one has rehearsed; what one has prepared
Meaning in native language: то что практиковал; то что репетировал; то что готовил
Commentary: (SNa) adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattanti yaṃ tuyhaṃ dīghena kālena paricitaṃ suppaguṇaṃ, taṃ mama vādaṃ āgamma sabbaṃ khaṇena viparāvattaṃ nivattaṃ.
Example1: adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo; cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito’si; nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: meditation; mental development; lit. higher mind
Meaning in native language: медиация; развитие ума; досл. высший разум
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicitta-sikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ’ca sayan’āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: engaged in meditation; devoted to mental development; cultivating the higher mind
Meaning in native language: занимающийся медитацией; посвятивший себя развитию ума; взращивающий высший разум

Meaning IN CONTEXT: meditation training; development of the higher mind
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: rare; unlikely; by chance; exceptional
Example1: idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu adhicc’āpattiko hoti anāpattibahulo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: rarely making transgression; by chance guilty of an offence; occasionally offending
Meaning in native language: редко совершающий проступок; случайно виновен в нарушении; иногда нарушающий
Example1: idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu adhicc’āpattiko hoti anāpattibahulo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: stands firmly; determines; resolves; fixes attention on
Meaning in native language: стоит твердо; устанавливает; намеревается; фокусирует внимание

Meaning IN CONTEXT: concentrating (on); focusing (on); fixing one's attention (on); determining
Example1:

etaṃ satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno,
adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: should be ordered; to be arranged; to be placed; should be applied; lit. to be stood on
Meaning in native language: должен быть назначен; может быть организован; может быть помещен; может быть применен; досл. следует стоять (на)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: stands firmly; takes a stand (upon); makes up one's mind; determines
Meaning in native language: твердо стоит; имеет твердое убеждение; принимает решение; определяет
