Example1: aṭṭhamaṃ adhiṭṭhānapārami, navamaṃ mettā-pārami, dasamaṃ upekkhā-pāramī'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: basis; foundation; standpoint
Example1: chadhāturo ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso chaphass'āyatano aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro caturo-adhiṭṭhāno

Meaning IN CONTEXT: standpoint; prejudice; bias; preconception
Meaning in native language: точка зрения; предвзятое мнение; предубеждение; предрассудок
Example1: bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān’ābhinives’ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbaloke anabhirata-saññā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: determination; decisive resolution; fixing the mind on
Example1: aṭṭhamaṃ adhiṭṭhāna-pārami, navamaṃ mettā-pārami, dasamaṃ upekkhā-pāramī'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: mental standpoints attachments and underlying tendencies; prejudices adherences and dormant proclivities
Meaning in native language: предвзятые мнения привязанности и скрытые склонности; предрассудки цепляния и скрытые тенденции
Example1: bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān’ābhinives’ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbaloke anabhirata-saññā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: concentrated (on); focused (on); fixed one's attention (on); determined (to)
Example1: atha kho āyasmā soṇo aparena samayena vīriyasamathaṃ adhiṭṭhāsi, indriyānañ'ca samataṃ paṭivijjhi, tattha ca nimittaṃ aggahesi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: committed (to); resolved (to); determined (to); lit. stood firmly
Meaning in native language: преданный; намеренный; определенный; досл. основательно стоящий
Example1:
paṇḍito'ti samaññāto, ekacariyaṃ adhiṭṭhito,
athā'pi methune yutto, mando'va parikissati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: could stand firmly; would determines; resolves
Meaning in native language: может стоять твердо; стоило бы устанавливать; намереваться
Example2:
tiṭṭhañ’caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat’assa vigata-middho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam’etaṃ vihāraṃ idha’m’āhu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: lord; master; ruler
Example1:
passanti devā ca tathāgatā ca, lokasmiṃ bālaṃ visamaṃ carantaṃ,
tasmā hi att'ādhipateyyako ca, loka-adhipo ca nipako ca jhāyī,
dhamm'ādhipo ca anudhammacārī, na hīyati saccaparakkamo muni.
Example2: buddh’ādhipa-varo nātho, dhammo nātho var’uttamo. nātho paccekabuddho ca saṅgho nāth’ottaro mamaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: higher insight; deep understanding; lit. higher wisdom
Meaning in native language: высшая проницательность; глубокое понимание; досл. высшая мудрость
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññā-sikkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: higher insight training; development of deep understanding
Meaning in native language: тренировка высшей проницательности; развитие глубокого понимания
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having attacked; having charged; lit. having fallen on
Commentary: (UDa) adhipatitvā'ti abhibhavitvā madditvā.
Example1: atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: predominant; ruling over; governing
Example2: magg’ārammaṇā dhammā. magga-hetukā dhammā. magg’ādhipatino dhammā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: master; ruler; person in charge
Example1: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: overseen by; ruled by; dominated by
Example1: ‘chanda-mūlakā, manasikāra-sambhavā, phassa-samudayā, vedanā-samosaraṇā, samādhi-ppamukhā, sat’ādhipateyyā, paññ’uttarā, vimutti-sārā, amat’ogadhā, nibbāna-pariyosānā sabbe dhammā’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: seized (by); assailed (by); victim (of); overpowered (by)
Example1:
na santi puttā tāṇāya, na pitā n'āpi bandhavā,
antaken'ādhipannassa, n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: great bondage; servitude
Example1: appamattako so kaliggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen’eva kaliggahena puttam’pi jīyetha, dāram’pi jīyetha, sabbaṃ sāpateyyam’pi jīyetha, uttari’pi adhibandhaṃ nigaccheyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: extreme; excessive; utmost; intense
Example1: seyyathā’pi āditta-celo vā āditta-sīso vā, tass’eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ’ca vāyāmañ’ca ussāhañ’ca ussoḷhiñ’ca appaṭivāniñ’ca satiñ’ca sampajaññañ’ca kareyya.
Example2: atthi dukkhaṃ adhimattaṃ, atthi parittaṃ, atthi dandha-virāgi, atthi khippa-virāgi. ayaṃ vuccati dukkhassa vemattatā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: overestimation of oneself; overrating oneself
Meaning in native language: переоценка себя; слишком высокая оценка себя
Example1: “ajānam’evaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ `jānāmi', apassaṃ `passāmi'. tucchaṃ musā vilapin”ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
Example2: kacci te, bhante, bhikkhū samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaṃsu udāhu sant'etth'ekacce bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsū'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is intent (on); is drawn (to); inclines (to); feels attached to; lit. is released towards
Meaning in native language: тянется (к); побуждается (к); склоняется (к); чувствует привязанность (к); досл. освобождается по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhita-kāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is settled (on); has made up one's mind (about); has faith (in); inclines (towards); lit. is released towards
Meaning in native language: успокаивается (по отношению к); принимает решение (об); имеет веру (в); склоняется (к); досл. освобождается по отношению (к)
Commentary: (SNa) adhimuccatī'ti saddh'ādhimokkhaṃ paṭilabhati.
Example1: viññāṇaṃ aniccan'ti passati. tassa dhāt'ārammaṇam'eva cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: becoming settled (towards); making up one's mind (about); having faith (in); inclining (towards); lit. being released towards
Meaning in native language: успокаивающийся (по отношению к); принявший решение (о); верящий (в); склоняющийся (к); досл. освобождающийся по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: cittaṃ adhiṭṭhahanto sikkheyya, saddhāya adhimuccanto sikkheyya, vīriyaṃ paggaṇhanto sikkheyya, satiṃ upaṭṭhapento sikkheyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: infatuated; greedy; strongly fixated on
Example2:
paṇītaṃ yadi vā lūkhaṃ, appaṃ vā yadi vā bahuṃ.
yāpan’atthaṃ abhuñjiṃsu, agiddhā n’ādhimucchitā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: set (on); intent (on); focused (on); fixed (on); inclined (towards); lit. with released towards
Meaning in native language: установленный (на); сосредоточенный (на); сфокусированный (на); склонный (к); досл. освобожденный по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: subhan’tv’eva adhimutto hoti — ayaṃ tatiyā disā
Example2:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ, ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: dedicated (to); accustomed (to); habituated (to); lit. released towards
Meaning in native language: преданный (чему-то); привыкший (к); приученный (к); досл. освобожденный по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohita-bhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma’d’aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: laid on; incubated
Commentary: (SNa) adhisayitānī'ti tāya ca janettiyā kukkuṭiyā pakkhe pasāretvā tesaṃ upari sayantiyā sammā adhisayitāni.
Example1: tān'assu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni

Meaning IN CONTEXT: higher virtue; higher conduct
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīla-sikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: training in higher virtue; development of higher conduct
Meaning in native language: тренировка высокой нравственности; развитие высшего поведения
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: lies flat (on); lies down (on)
Example2:
aciraṃ vat’ayaṃ kāyo, paṭhaviṃ adhisessati.
chuḍḍho apeta-viññāṇo, niratthaṃ’va kaliṅgaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: term (for); name (for); expression (for); epithet (of); designation (for); metaphor
Example1: 'orimaṃ tīran’ti kho chann’etaṃ ajjhattikānaṃ āyatanānaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ‘pārimaṃ tīran’ti kho channetaṃ bāhirānaṃ āyatanānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Example2: “daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: pathway of expression; mode of designation
Example1: tayo'me, bhikkhave, niruttipathā adhivacanapathā paññattipathā asaṅkiṇṇā asaṅkiṇṇapubbā, na saṅkīyanti, na saṅkīyissanti, appaṭikuṭṭhā samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: comes on; overwhelms; roll to; accrue to
Meaning in native language: приходит (к); наполняет; катится (на); выпадает на долю
Example1:
patirūpe vase dese, ariya-mitta-karo siyā.
sammā-paṇidhi-sampanno, pubbe puññakato naro.
dhaññaṃ dhanaṃ yaso kitti, sukhaṃ-cetaṃ-adhivattatī;

Meaning IN CONTEXT: enduring; patient
Example1: kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsaka-jātiko hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who is patient; who endures; lit. patient type
Meaning in native language: терпеливый; кто терпит; досл. терпеливого типа
Example1: kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: endurance; forbearance; patience
Example1: atthi āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā – duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: enduring; tolerating; weathering
Example1: yañ’hi’ssa, bhikkhave, anadhivāsayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā, adhivāsayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā na honti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: agrees (to); consents (to); accepts
Example1: tam’enaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upasaṅkamitvā svātanāya bhattena nimanteti. ākaṅkhamāno, jīvaka, bhikkhu adhivāseti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: patiences; bears; endures; tolerates

Meaning IN CONTEXT: agreed (to); consented (to); accepted

Example2: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena

Meaning IN CONTEXT: higher; up to; completely; very; strongly
Meaning in native language: выше; вплоть до; полностью; очень; сильно
Commentary:
adhicitta - lit. higher mind
adhigacchati – attains, reaches, goes up to
adhiggaṇhāti - possess; lit. totally gets
Notes:
adhimucchitā – infatuated, very greedy
adhiṭṭheyya -could stand firmly
Example1:
adhi-citta-sikkhā
ratiṃ so na-adhi-gacchati
adhi-ggaṇhāti paṇḍito
Example2:
agiddhā na-adhi-mucchitā
etaṃ satiṃ adhi-ṭṭheyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: belonging to; subject to; subservient to

Meaning IN CONTEXT: recently; now; presently; at this time
Meaning in native language: недавно; сейчас; в настоящее время; нынче
Example1: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ - ‘adhun’āgata-vadhukā-samena cetasā viharissāmā’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: recently came (to); newly arrived (to)
Example1: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: like a recently arrived young wife
Example1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, adhun'āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unstable; not enduring; not eternal
Meaning in native language: не стабильный; не прочный; не вечный

Meaning IN CONTEXT: going downwards; descending
Example1: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅg'ānusārino vātā, assāso passāso

Meaning IN CONTEXT: going downwards; descending; sinking
Example1: “seyyathā’pi puriso sappi-kumbhaṃ vā tela-kumbhaṃ vā gambhīraṃ udaka-rahadaṃ ogāhitvā bhindeyya. tatra yā assa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa

Meaning IN CONTEXT: going downstream; going down
Meaning in native language: спускающийся вниз по течению; двигающийся вниз
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.28) adhogāminin'ti ojavanikāya.
(VINa) adhogāminin'ti adho anusotaṃ gacchantiṃ.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of the body) lower part; lower portion
Example1: yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ adhobhāgaṃ nikkhamati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: glum; downcast; dispirited; lit. face downward
Meaning in native language: угрюмый; подавленный; унылый; досл. лицом вниз
Example1: evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy’antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: shaken off; tossed off
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: purgative; laxative; which induces diarrhoea; lit. purging down
Meaning in native language: слабительное; что вызывает диарею; досл. опустошение вниз
Commentary: (DNa) adhovirecanan'ti adho dosānaṃ nīharaṇaṃ.
Example1: tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: below; under
Example1: ayaṃ kho me kāyo uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesa-matthakā taca-pariyanto pūro nānappakārassa asucino
Example2:
mettañ’ca sabba-lokasmiṃ, mānasam’bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ;
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyañ’ca, asambādhaṃ, averaṃ, asapattaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: downwards
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adho-gāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not; (negative prefix before consonants)
Example1: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n’ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti ana-bhāvaṃ gameti
Example2:
na cīvare na sayane, bhojane nupalimpati.
gotamo ana-ppameyyo, muḷālapupphaṃ vimalaṃva.
ambunā nekkhammaninno, tibhavābhinissaṭo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: indescribable; ineffable; indefinable; inexpressible; unspeakable; unnameable
Commentary: (DHPa) anakkhāte'ti nibbāne.

chandajāto anakkhāte, manasā ca phuṭo siyā,
kāmesu ca appaṭibaddhacitto, uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unsaid; untold; uninformed; undeclared; unstated; not made known
Meaning in native language: невысказанный; не выраженный; не объявленный; неустановленный; не обнародованный
Example1: etad'eva kho pana mayaṃ bhoto gotamassa ārocetu'kāmā. atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo anakkhātaṃ'y'eva akkhāsī'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: homelessness
Example1: yass’atthāya kulaputtā samma’d’eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti
Example2: yan’nūn’āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: spotless; blemish free

niṭṭhaṅ’gato asantāsī, vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni, antimo’yaṃ samussayo.
Example2: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat’ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte

Meaning IN CONTEXT: more wonderful; most marvellous
Example1: apissu maṃ, bhikkhave, imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṃsu pubbe assutapubbā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not fallen into error; without mistake; guiltless
Meaning in native language: не совершивший оплошность; без ошибки; невиновный
Example1: aladdhā ca cīvaraṃ na ca paritassissāma, laddhā ca cīvaraṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not blindly absorbed; not obsessed
Construction: na > an + adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + √pad + na
Example1: so taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ agathito amucchito anajjhopanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not clinging; not fixating; not holding tightly
Meaning in native language: не цепляясь; не привязываясь; не держась крепко
Construction:
na > an + adhi + ava + √sā + ya
na + ajjhosāya
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhu n’ābhinandati n’ābhivadati n’ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. ‘nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā’ti vadāmi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not fixed in; not clinging to; unattached to
Meaning in native language: в котором не установлен; к которому не цепляется; к которому не привязан
Construction: na > an + adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + √sā + ita
Commentary: (MNa) anajjhositā'ti gilitvā pariniṭṭhāpetvā gahetuṃ na yutthā'ti pajānāti.
Example1: so sukhañ'ce vedanaṃ vedeti, sā aniccā'ti pajānāti, anajjhositā'ti pajānāti, anabhinanditā'ti pajānāti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not another; no other
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.16) anaññan'ti na añño koci paccayo
Example1: `yassa sambādho bhavissati so pakkamissatī'ti, eta'deva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: āgatāni kho, tāta uttara, amhākaṃ mantesu dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dve'y'eva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not depending on another
Example2: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not understood; not known; unknown
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātañ-ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātañ-ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: faculty that senses 'I will know the unknown'
Construction: na > an + aññāta + ñassāmi + iti + indriya
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-arrogance; humility; non-haughtiness; meekness
Example1: atimānissa purisapuggalassa anatimāno hoti parinibbānāya. dubbacassa purisapuggalassa sovacassatā hoti parinibbānāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not conceited; humble; without arrogance; lit. not think too much
Meaning in native language: не тщеславный; скромный; не высокомерный; досл. не думает слишком много
Example2:
karaṇīyam’attha-kusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca:
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c’assa mudu, anatimānī.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not left over; not remaining
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.35) anatirittaṃ nāma akappiyakataṃ hoti, appaṭiggahitakataṃ hoti, anuccāritakataṃ hoti, ahatthapāse kataṃ hoti, abhuttāvinā kataṃ hoti, bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti, alametaṃ sabban'ti avuttaṃ hoti, na gilān'ātirittaṃ hoti
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, bhuttāvī pavārito, anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not overstepping; not overshooting; not overturning
Example1: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca anabhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca anatisāro?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not past; not free from; not having got over; lit. not overcome
Meaning in native language: несвободный (от); не избавленный; досл. не преодолел
Example1: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarā-dhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva {na} atisitvā, aham’pi kho’mhi jarā-dhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Example2: jarā-dhammo’mhi jaraṃ anatīto

Meaning IN CONTEXT: as impersonal; as not oneself; as nonsubjective; as essence-less
Meaning in native language: как не персональный; как безличный; как без-самостный; как без сущностный
Commentary: (MNa) na att'aṭṭhena anattato
Example1: ye’pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam’addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.
Example2: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in non-self
Example1:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham’addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani ‘anattā’ti, asubhaṃ asubhat’addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhi-samādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun’ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: irritated; annoyed; displeased; not delighted; lit. not own mind
Meaning in native language: раздраженный; раздосадованный; недовольный; досл. не свой ум
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.3.5) kupito anattamano'ti anabhiraddho āhatacitto khilajāto.
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgato na c’eva anattamano hoti, na ca anattamanataṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, anavassuto ca viharati sato sampajāno.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā, kupito anattamano, acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: irritation; annoyance; displeasure; lit. not own mind state
Meaning in native language: раздражение; досада; неудовольствие; досл. состояние не своего ума
Construction:
na > an + atta + mana + tā
anattamana + tā
Commentary: (VINa) tāya ca anattamanatāyā'ti yāya anattamano'ti vutto ... imehi dvīhi vedanākkhandhaṃ dasseti.
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgato na c’eva anattamano hoti, na ca anattamanataṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, anavassuto ca viharati sato sampajāno.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: perception of not self; recognition of impersonality
Example1: iti imesu chasu ajjhattika-bāhiresu āyatanesu anatt’ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, anattasaññā.
Example2: yāvakīvañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anattasaññaṃ bhāvessanti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: which has frequently practised perception of impersonality (in)
Example1: dukkhe anattasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'āpagataṃ mānasaṃ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṃ santaṃ suvimuttaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: impersonal; not oneself; non-subjective; essence-less; non subject to identify with
Meaning in native language: не персональный; без личностный; без самости; без сущностный; не следует само-отождествляться (с)
Example3:
“sabbe dhammā anattā”ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: which is impersonal; non-self; not subject to identification
Meaning in native language: тот что безличный; не сущностный; с которым не следует отождествляться
Example1: sakkā evam’eva viññāṇaṃ pidaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññapetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ — ‘iti’p’idaṃ viññāṇaṃ anattā’”ti?
Example2: “rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ’ca h’idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na’y’idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe — ‘evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī’ti.
English chant 2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

Meaning IN CONTEXT: observing the impersonal nature (of); watching non-self
Meaning in native language: наблюдающий безличную природу; созерцающий отсутствие самости
Commentary: (ANa) anattānupassī'ti avasavattan'ākāraṃ anattā'ti anupassanto.
Example1: iti imesu chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu anatt'ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccatānanda, anattasaññā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: harm; damage; injury; misfortune; lit. un-benefit
Meaning in native language: вред; ущерб; повреждение; беда; досл. не благо
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anattha-kāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh’allik’ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anattha-sañhito
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not well-wishing; not benevolent; lit. not desiring benefit
Meaning in native language: не желающий благо; не доброжелательный; досл. не желающий пользы
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unbeneficial saying; unprofitable verse; useless poem
Meaning in native language: не благое высказывание; невыгодная строка; бесполезное стихотворение
Example1:
sahassam’api ce gāthā, anatthapada-saṃhitā,
ekaṃ gāthā-padaṃ seyyo, yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not profitable; meaningless; unbeneficial; lit. not connected with good
Example1:
yaṃ samaṇo bahuṃ bhāsati,
upetaṃ atthasañhitaṃ,
jānaṃ so dhammaṃ deseti,
jānaṃ so bahu bhāsati.
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ attakilamath’ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unprofitable; meaningless; unbeneficial; lit. not connected with good
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, yaṃ jaññā rahovādaṃ abhūtaṃ atacchaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ sasakkaṃ taṃ rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya.
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh’allik’ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasaṃhito

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who speaks what is unbeneficial
Commentary:
(MNa) anatthavādī'ti akāraṇanissitaṃ vattā
(ANa) anatthavādī'ti atthaṃ na vadati, anatthaṃ vadati nāma.
(ANa) anatthaṃ vadati, no atthan'ti anatthavādī.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unbeneficial (for); unfortunate (for); lit. for the harm (of)
Example1:
yāva'd'eva anatthāya, ñattaṃ bālassa jāyati,
hanti bālassa sukk'aṃsaṃ, muddham'assa vipātayaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not reached; has not been attained
Example2: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not enduring; not tolerating; not weathering
Meaning in native language: не выносящий; не терпящий; не выдерживающий
Example1: yañ’hi’ssa, bhikkhave, anadhivāsayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā, adhivāsayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā na honti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not covetous; not greedy
Meaning in native language: не жаждущий; не жадный; не испытывавший страстное желание
Example2:
santussako ca subharo ca, appakicco ca sallahuka-vutti,
sant’indriyo ca nipako ca, appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unfitting; unsuitable; improper; lit. not following the skin; not along the skin
Meaning in native language: несоответствующий; неподходящий; неуместный; досл. не следующий по коже; не вдоль кожи
Construction:
na + anu + chavi + ka
na + anucchavi + ka
Example1: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-comprehension; misunderstanding
Example1: catunnaṃ dhammānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam’idaṃ dīgham’addhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañ’c’eva tumhākañ’ca

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not devoted (to); not applying oneself (to); not practising; lit. not yoked near
Meaning in native language: не посвящен (чему то); не применивший себя (к); не практикующий; досл. не запряженный рядом
Example1: bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ ananuyuttassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viharato kiñ'c'āpi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata me anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucceyyā'ti
Example2: tassa vāt'ātape cārittaṃ ananuyuttassa rajosūkaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ n'ānuddhaṃseyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-practice; non-devotion; non-pursuit; non-doing
Meaning in native language: не практика; не преданность; не стремление (к); не выполнение
Example1: ananuyogo ca kho adukkho eso dhammo anupaghāto anupāyāso apariḷāho; sammāpaṭipadā’ti—iti vadaṃ dhammam’eva deseti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: improper; unsuitable; not in accordance (with); lit. not following the hair
Meaning in native language: неподходящий; неуместный; не в соответствии (с); досл. против шерсти
Construction:
na > an + anu + loma + ika
ananuloma + ika
Example1: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unheard
Example2: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not blameworthy; praiseworthy; faultless; lit. not to be blamed (for)
Meaning in native language: не заслуживающий порицания; достойный похвалы; безупречный; досл. не следует упрекать
Example1: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnan”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: undiscoverable; untraceable; not able to be ascertained; lit. not to be found
Meaning in native language: не обнаруживаемый; не отслеживаемый; невозможно установить; досл. не может быть найден
Example1: evaṃ vimuttacittaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ saindā devā sabrahmakā sapajāpatikā anvesaṃ n'ādhigacchanti, idaṃ nissitaṃ tathāgatassa viññāṇan'ti. taṃ kissa hetu? diṭṭh'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhamme tathāgataṃ ananuvijjo'ti vadāmi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: infinite; endless; boundless; without limit
Example1: nissaṭṭhena āvuso, pañcahi indriyehi parisuddhena manoviññāṇena ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, anantaṃ viññāṇan'ti
Example2: puññass’idāni katassa yān’aññāni katāni me, tesañ’ca bhāgino hontu satt’ānant’āppamāṇakā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: contiguous; immediate; immediately following; lit. no space in between
Meaning in native language: смежный; немедленный; сразу следующий; досл. нет места между
Example2: hetu-paccayo, ārammaṇa-paccayo, adhipati-paccayo, anantara-paccayo, samanantara-paccayo, sahajāta-paccayo, aññam’añña-paccayo,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: endless; infinite; unlimited; lit. having no end quality
Example1: kiṃ pana, bhante, anantavā loko, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti? etam'pi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā abyākataṃ, anantavā loko, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not blind; who can see; not spiritually ignorant; lit. not dark
Meaning in native language: не слепой; кто может видеть; не духовно невежественный; досл. не темный
Example1: evaṃ pasanno ahaṃ bhoto gotamassa! pahoti me bhavaṃ gotamo tathā dhammaṃ desetuṃ yath'āhaṃ imamhā āsanā anandho vuṭṭhaheyyan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unafflicted; undistressed; unperturbed; unagitated; lit. not beaten
Meaning in native language: не пораженный; не страдающий (от); невозмутимый; не взволнованный; досл. не побитый
Construction: na > an + anu + ā > anvā + √han + ta
Example1:
anavassuta-cittassa, ananvāhata-cetaso,
puññapāpa-pahīnassa, n'atthi jāgarato bhayaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without reason; without grounds; unreasonable; (comm) without foundation in the discourses
Meaning in native language: без причины; безосновательный; необоснованный; (комм) не основывающийся на лекциях
Commentary:
(MNa) anapadesan'ti sutt'āpadesavirahitaṃ.
(ANa) anapadesan'ti apadesarahitaṃ, sāpadesaṃ sakāraṇaṃ katvā na katheti.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī, anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: never leaving; always following; lit. not going away
Meaning in native language: никогда не покидающий; всегда следующий; досл. не уходящий (от)
Example1:
mano-pubbaṅ’gamā dhammā, mano-seṭṭhā mano-mayā.
manasā ce pasannena, bhāsati vā karoti vā.
tato naṃ sukham’anveti, chāyā’va anapāyinī

Meaning IN CONTEXT: indifferent (to); disinterested (in); unconcerned (with); without desire (for); lit. not looking out (in)
Meaning in native language: безразличный (к); не заинтересованный (в); равнодушный; безучастный; без желания; досл. не смотрящий вовне (на)
Example1: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya atītasmiṃ rūpasmiṃ anapekkho hoti; anāgataṃ rūpaṃ n’ābhinandati; paccuppannassa rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: indifferent (to); unconcerned (with); disinterested (in); lit. not looking out (in)
Meaning in native language: безразличный (к); равнодушный (к); незаинтересованный (в); досл. не смотрящий вовне (на)
Example1:
eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ, app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ, kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma, kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī”ti.
Example2:
etaṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā, ohārinaṃ sithilaṃ duppamuñcaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna paribbajanti, anapekkhino kāmasukhaṃ pahāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: great; considerable; not insignificant
Example1:
asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho, ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca, samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā, jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.
Example2: so ñātidhammo ca ayaṃ nidassito, petāna’pūjā ca katā uḷārā. balañ’ca bhikkhūnam’anuppadinnaṃ, tumhehi puññaṃ pasutaṃ anappakan’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not rehabilitated; not reintegrated; not readmitted; lit. not called back
Meaning in native language: не реабилитированный; не восстановленный; досл. не призванный назад
Commentary: (VINa) anabbhito'ti na abbhito, asampaṭicchito, akatabbhānakammo'ti vuttaṃ hoti, anavhāto'ti vā attho.
Example1: ekena'pi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuṃ abbheyya so ca bhikkhu anabbhito te ca bhikkhū gārayhā. ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: obliteration; annihilation; total destruction
Example1: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n’ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
Example2: te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl’āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃ-katā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā. tasmā tathāgato ‘anokasārī’ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: utterly obliterated; totally annihilated; lit. made non-existent
Meaning in native language: полностью удаленный; совершенно уничтоженный; досл. сделанный несуществующим
Example1: te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl’āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā. tasmā tathāgato ‘anokasārī’ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: obliterates; totally destroys; lit. cause to go to annihilation
Meaning in native language: удаляет; разрушает; досл. приводит к полному уничтожению
Example1: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n’ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not directly knowing; not understanding experientially; not knowing for oneself
Meaning in native language: не знающий напрямую; не понимающий на опыте; не знающий для себя
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, anabhijānaṃ, uttarimanussadhammaṃ att’ūpanāyikaṃ alam’ariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya: “iti jānāmi, iti passāmī”ti,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not covetous; not greedy
Example1:
‘abhijjhālu vā anabhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?

Commentary: (SNa) apunāgamanaṃ anāgantā puriso maccudheyyā'ti tebhūmakavaṭṭasaṅkhātā maccudheyyā apun'āgamanasaṅkhātaṃ nibbānaṃ anāgantā. nibbānañ'hi sattā na pun'āgacchanti, tasmā taṃ apun'āgamanan'ti vuccati. taṃ kāmesu baddho ca pamatto ca anāgantā nāma hoti, so taṃ pāpuṇituṃ na sakkoti, tasmā evam'āha.
Example1:
na santi kāmā manujesu niccā,
sant'īdha kamanīyāni yesu baddho,

anāgantā puriso maccudheyyā'ti.

anāgāmī + tā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not angry; without malice

Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

Meaning IN CONTEXT: disrespect; rudeness; contemptuous behaviour
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.54) anādariyaṃ nāma dve anādariyāni, puggal'ānādariyañ'ca dhamm'ānādariyañ'ca.
(KVa) anādariye'ti ... tasmā yo bhikkhu upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno tassa vā vacanaṃ akattu'kāmatāya, taṃ vā dhammaṃ asikkhitu'kāmatāya anādariyaṃ karoti, tassa tasmiṃ anādariye pācittiyaṃ.
Example1: anādariye, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: hirīmā’yaṃ, bhikkhave, ottāpī appamatto hoti. so appamatto samāno bhabbo anādariyaṃ pahātuṃ dovacassataṃ pahātuṃ pāpamittataṃ pahātuṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not taking; not including; not applying
Meaning in native language: не беря; не включая; не применяя
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.13) anādā ... anādiyitvā
Example1: anādā ce bhikkhu dve bhāge suddha-kāḷakānaṃ eḷaka-lomānaṃ, tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ, catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ
Example2: anādā ce bhikkhu tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: free from attachment; not grasping; not taking anything as one's own; lit. not taking
Meaning in native language: свободный от привязанности; не цепляющийся; не принимающий ничего как свое; досл. не берущий
Example1:
vītataṇho anādāno, niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ, jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,
sa ve antimasārīro mahāpañño, mahāpuriso'ti vuccati.
Example2:
na c'āhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brūmi, yonijaṃ mattisambhavaṃ,
bhovādi nāma so hoti, sace hoti sakiñcano,
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not taking
Example2: “nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ, aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya. samūlaṃ taṇham’abbuyha, nicchāto parinibbuto”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not taking up; not grasping; not accepting
Meaning in native language: не берущий; не хватающий; не принимающий
Example1:
tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā, pakappitā n'atthi aṇū'pi saññā,
taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ, ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not seeing the danger in; not seeing the disadvantage of
Meaning in native language: не видящий опасность (в); не осознающий вред (от)
Example1: cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā uppajjati upekkhā bālassa mūḷhassa puthujjanassa anodhijinassa avipākajinassa anādīnavadassāvino assutavato puthujjanassa.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not speaking on diverse topics
Example1: saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (prefix)
Example1:
yo attano sīlavatāni jantu, anānu-puṭṭho’va paresa pāva,
anariyadhammaṃ kusalā tam’āhu, yo ātumānaṃ sayam’eva pāva.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not greedy
Example1:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yad'attagarahī tad'akubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not accepting; not allowing; not permitting; not agreeing (with)
Meaning in native language: не принимающий; не позволяющий; не разрешающий; не соглашающийся (с)
Construction:
na > an + anu + jānā + nta
an + anujānanta
Example1:
parassa ce dhammam'anānujānaṃ, bālomako hoti nihīnapañño,
sabb'eva bālā sunihīnapaññā, sabb'ev'ime diṭṭhiparibbasānā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unasked; unquestioned
Commentary: (SNPa) anānupuṭṭho'ti apucchito.
Example1:
yo attano sīlavatāni jantu, anānupuṭṭho'va paresa pāva,
anariyadhammaṃ kusalā tam'āhu, yo ātumānaṃ sayam'eva pāva.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who is not full of offences; who is not in the habit of offending
Meaning in native language: кто не полон проступков; кто не имеет обыкновения нарушать
Example1: idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu adhicc’āpattiko hoti anāpattibahulo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of a monk) who has not committed; who has not fallen into (an offence)
Meaning in native language: (монах) который не совершил; не опустился до (нарушения)
Example1: tass’etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ — anāpanno vā pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ na āpajjissati, āpanno vā pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ yathādhammaṃ paṭikarissati.
Example2: yāvatikā ca bhikkhū kammappattā saṅgh'uposath'ārahā cattāro vā tato vā atirekā pakatattā pārājikaṃ anāpannā saṅghena vā anukkhittā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not asking; not informing; not taking leave
Meaning in native language: не спрашивая; не сообщая; не информируя об уходе
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchā vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu, nimantito sabhatto samāno, santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā, purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not exerting oneself; not pushing forward; not making an effort; not straining
Meaning in native language: не напрягающийся; не давящий вперед; который не тужится; кто не переутомляется
Example1:
cirassaṃ vata passāmi,
brāhmaṇaṃ parinibbutaṃ,
appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ,
tiṇṇaṃ loke visattikan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not exerting oneself; not pushing forward; not making an effort; not straining
Meaning in native language: не напрягающийся; не давящий вперед; который не тужится; не переутомляется
Construction:
na > an + ā + yūha + nta
an + āyūhanta
Commentary: (SNa) anāyūhan'ti anāyūhanto, avāyamanto'ti attho.
Example1: kathaṃ nu tvaṃ, mārisa, ogham'atarī'ti? appatiṭṭhaṃ khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, anāyūhaṃ ogham'atarin'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: free from injury; without harm (to living creatures); lit. without violence
Meaning in native language: без травм; без вреда (живым существам); досл. без насилия
Commentary: (VIN a) sārambhaṃ anārambhan'ti saupaddavaṃ anupaddavaṃ.
Example1: bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthu’desanāya. tehi bhikkhūhi vatthuṃ desetabbaṃ, anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-activity; which has no karmic activity; epithet of Nibbāna; lit. not undertaking
Meaning in native language: отсутствие активности; отсутствие кармической деятельности; эпитет Ниббаны; досл. не предприятие
Commentary: (SNPa) anārambhe vimuttino'ti anārambhe nibbāne vimuttassa.
Example1:
etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
dukkhaṃ ārambhapaccayā,
sabb'ārambhaṃ paṭinissajja,
anārambhe vimuttino.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: ignoble; vulgar; coarse
Example1:
methunam'anuyuttassa, mussate v'āpi sāsanaṃ,
micchā ca paṭipajjati, etaṃ tasmiṃ anāriyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: independence; freedom from clinging; non-attachment
Meaning in native language: независимость; свобода от цепляния; не привязанность
Example3: idaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ — yo tassā’y’eva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo.
English chant 3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fasting; starvation; not eating food
Construction:
na > an + ā + √as > ās + *a + kā
anāsa + kā
Example1:
na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā, na-anāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ, sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unsuitable seat
Example1: yathārūpe anāsane nisinnaṃ yathārūpe agocare carantaṃ; yathārūpe pāpake mitte bhajantaṃ viññū sabrahmacārī pāpakesu ṭhānesu okappeyyuṃ;

Meaning IN CONTEXT: free from the effluents; taint-less; undefiled
Meaning in native language: свободный от протечек; без пятен; не загрязненный
Example1: puggalo āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ ceto-vimuttiṃ paññā-vimuttiṃ diṭṭh’eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
Example2:
“sa ve samm’addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā.
so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo.
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n’opeti vedagū”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not destined to return; lit. non-returning nature
Meaning in native language: кому предначертано не возвращаться; досл. природы не возвращаться
Example1: santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātikā tattha parinibbāyino anāvattidhammā tasmā lokā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not obstructive; not blocking; not impeding
Meaning in native language: не препятствующий; не затрудняющий; не задерживающий
Example1: satt'ime, brāhmaṇa, bojjh'aṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimutti-phalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having not explained; having not made clear; having not openly declared; having not revealed
Meaning in native language: не разъяснив; не объяснив; не заявив открыто; не обнаружив
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhā-sājīva-samāpanno, sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā, methunaṃ dhammaṃ patiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of water) tranquil; placid; glassy; smooth; lit. ripple-free
Meaning in native language: (о воде) спокойный; прозрачный; гладкий; досл. без ряби
Example1: seyyathā’pi pabbatasaṅkhepe udakarahado accho vippasanno anāvilo. tattha cakkhumā puriso tīre ṭhito passeyya sippi-sambukam’pi sakkharakathalam’pi macchagumbam’pi, carantam’pi tiṭṭhantam’pi.
Example2:
yathā'pi rahado gambhīro, vippasanno anāvilo,
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna, vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of mind) still; serene; tranquil; lit. ripple-free
Meaning in native language: (об уме) спокойный; безмятежный; неподвижный; досл. без ряби
Example1:
candaṃ'va vimalaṃ suddhaṃ, vippasannam'anāvilaṃ,
nandībhavaparikkhīṇaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of food) not brought near; not taken to
Example1: na anāhaṭe kabaḷe mukhadvāraṃ vivarissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without fuel; without nutriment; lit. without food
Meaning in native language: без топлива; без питания; досл. без еды
Example1: “avijjam’p’āhaṃ sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c’āhāro avijjāya? ‘pañca nīvaraṇā’ti’ssa vacanīyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: poor; impoverished; not rich
Notes: (BD) āḷhaka – measure of rise, anāḷhika – who does not posses even a single measure of rise
Example1: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañ'ca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not finished having fun (with); who has not fulfilled one's desires (for); who has not finished dabbling (in)
Meaning in native language: кто не закончил развлекаться (с); кто не исполнил свои желания; кто не закончил баловаться (с)
Commentary: (SNa) anikīḷitāvino kāmesū’ti yā kāmesu kāmakīḷā, taṃ akīḷitapubbā, aparibhuttakāmā’ti attho.
Example1: paṭhamena vayasā anikīḷitāvino kāmesu yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caranti, addhānañ’ca āpādentī”ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: homeless
Example1:
okaṃ pahāya aniketa-sārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not settled in a home; wandering homeless; roaming without an abode
Meaning in native language: не осевший в доме; странствующий без обиталища; блуждающий без жилья
Example1:
okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.
Example2: tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl’āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā. tasmā tathāgato ‘aniketasārī’ti vuccati

Meaning IN CONTEXT: impure; corrupt; filthy; unstainless; lit. not without impurity
Meaning in native language: нечистый; испорченный; грязный; не безупречный; досл. не без загрязненности
Example1:
anikkasāvo kāsāvaṃ, yo vatthaṃ paridahissati,
apeto damasaccena, na so kāsāvam'arahati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has not finished having fun (with); who has not fulfilled one's desires (for); who has not finished dabbling (in)
Meaning in native language: кто не закончил развлекаться (с); кто не исполнил свои желания; кто не закончил баловаться (с)
Commentary: (SNa) anikkīḷitāvī kāmesū'ti kāmesu akīḷitakīḷo abhuttāvī, akatakāmakīḷo'ti attho.
Notes: (MW) nikrīḍ to cease or finish playing
Example1: daharo tvaṃ bhikkhu, pabbajito susu kāḷakeso, bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato, paṭhamena vayasā, anikkīḷitāvī kāmesu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not departed; not left; not gone out
Meaning in native language: не ушедший; не вышедший; не покинувший
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu rañño, khattiyassa muddh’ābhisittassa, anikkhanta-rājake aniggataratanake, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito, indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: from which the king has not departed
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.83) anikkhantarājake'ti rājā sayanigharā anikkhanto hoti.
(VINa) anikkhanto rājā ito'ti anikkhantarājakaṃ, tasmiṃ anikkhantarājake, sayanighare'ti attho.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu rañño, khattiyassa muddh’ābhisittassa, anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito, indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: taking responsibility; not shirking one's duty; lit. not putting down the yoke pole
Meaning in native language: берущий ответственность; не уклоняющийся от обязанностей
Example1: “seyyathā’pi rañño paccantime nagare bahu-balakāyo paṭivasati, evam’evaṃ kho ariyasāvako āraddhavīriyo viharati, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not gone out (from); not left (from); not departed (from)
Meaning in native language: не ушедший; не вышедший; не покинувший
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu rañño, khattiyassa muddh’ābhisittassa, anikkhantarājake aniggata-ratanake, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito, indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: from which the queen has not departed
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.83) aniggataratanake'ti mahesī sayanigharā anikkhantā hoti, ubho vā anikkhantā honti.
(VINa) aniggataṃ ratanaṃ ito'ti aniggataratanakaṃ, tasmiṃ aniggataratanake, sayanighare'ti attho.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu rañño, khattiyassa muddh’ābhisittassa, anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito, indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: untroubled; undisturbed; calm; lit. free from trembling
Meaning in native language: не обеспокоенный; не потревоженный; досл. свободный от колебаний
Commentary: (SNPa) īgh'ābhāvato anīgho.
Example1:
taṃ chinnaganthaṃ anighaṃ nirāsaṃ,
pariyesamānā n'ājjhagamuṃ.
devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā sabbanivesanesu.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fact of impermanence; state of instability; state of unreliability
Example1: rūpānaṃ tv’eva aniccataṃ viditvā vipariṇāmavirāganirodhaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: as impermanent; as unstable; as transient; as unreliable
Meaning in native language: как непостоянный; как неустойчивый; как преходящий; как ненадежный
Commentary: (MNa) aniccato'ti na niccato
Example1:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham’addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani ‘anattā’ti, asubhaṃ asubhat’addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhi-samādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun’ti
Example2:
yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda, dukkham’addakkhi sallato.
adukkham’asukhaṃ santaṃ, addakkhi naṃ aniccato.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who seldom sees; who rarely gets to see
Meaning in native language: кто редко видит; кто редко получает возможность лицезреть
Commentary: (SNa) aniccadassāvī'ti tāya āturatāya icchit'icchitakkhaṇe āgantuṃ asakkonto kadāci'd'eva daṭṭhuṃ labhāmi, na sabbakālan'ti attho
Example1: aniccadassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: recognition of impermanence; perception of instability
Example1: iti imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anicc’ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, aniccasaññā.
Example2: yāvakīvañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū aniccasaññaṃ bhāvessanti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: which has frequently practised perception of instability (in)
Example1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno aniccasaññāparicitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharato lābhasakkārasiloke cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: devoted to the development of the recognition of impermanence; engaged in the cultivation of the perception of instability
Meaning in native language: посвятивший себя развитию осознания непостоянства; занимающийся взращиванием восприятия нестабильности
Commentary: (MNa) aniccasaññābhāvan'ānuyogan'ti ettha saññāsīsena vipassanā kathitā.
Example1: santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe aniccasaññābhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: impermanent; unstable; unreliable
Example1:
“sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.
Example3: “taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti? “aniccaṃ, bhante”.
English chant 3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

Meaning IN CONTEXT: rare; irregular; unusual
Commentary: (SNa) aniccadassāvī'ti tāya āturatāya icchit'icchitakkhaṇe āgantuṃ asakkonto kadāci'd'eva daṭṭhuṃ labhāmi, na sabbakālan'ti attho
Example1: anicca-dassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: nature of impermanence etc.; characteristic of instability etc.
Meaning in native language: природа непостоянства и т.д.; характеристика нестабильности и т.д.
Example1: yathā hi cakkhuviññāṇaṃ rūpe rūpamattam’eva passati, na anicc’ādisabhāvaṃ, evam’eva sesaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: observing impermanence; watching instability
Example1: iti imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anicc’ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, aniccasaññā.
Example3: anicc'ānupassī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, anicc'ānupassī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati

Meaning IN CONTEXT: subject to instability abrasion; erosion; breakage and falling apart; nature of impermanence; rubbing away; crushing; injury and destruction
Meaning in native language: подверженный нестабильности; истиранию; эрозии; поломке и распаду; природы непостоянства; истирания крушения; повреждения и разрушения
Construction: anicca + ucchādana + parimaddana + bhedana + viddhaṃsana + dhamma
Sanskrit: anitya + ucchādana + parimardana + bhedana + vidhvaṃsa + dharma
Example1: gaṇḍo’ti kho, bhikkhave, imass’etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettika-sambhavassa odana-kummās’ūpacayassa anicc’ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammassa.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: disliking; dispassion; lit. not desiring
Example1: “katamā dasa? aniccasaññā, anattasaññā, asubhasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchā-saññā, ānāpānassati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: recognition of dispassion; perception of not desiring
Example1: “katamā dasa? aniccasaññā, anattasaññā, asubhasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, ānāpānassati.
Example2: idh’ānanda, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāresu aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not perturbating; not agitating; not disturbing
Meaning in native language: не возмущающийся; не волнующийся; не беспокоящийся
Example1: iñjitaṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, iñjitaṃ gaṇḍo, iñjitaṃ sallaṃ. tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, ‘aniñjamānena cetasā viharissāmā’ti — evañ’hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unpleasant; dislikeable; disagreeable; lit. not wished for
Meaning in native language: отталкивающий; непривлекательный; неприятный; досл. не желаемый
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not come to a conclusion (about); not reached surety (about); in doubt (about)
Meaning in native language: не пришедший к заключению (об); не достигший уверенности (в); сомневающийся (в)
Example1: ‘kaṅkhī vat’amhi vicikicchī aniṭṭhaṅ'gato saddhamme’ti. ime kho cattāro maraṇadhammā samānā bhāyanti, santāsaṃ āpajjanti maraṇassa.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not crossed over
Example1: ‘amhākaṃ kho yā parittā sambalamattā sā parikkhīṇā pariyādiṇṇā. atthi c’āyaṃ kantār’āvaseso anittiṇṇo

Meaning IN CONTEXT: non-visible
Example2: sanidassana-sappaṭighā dhammā. anidassana-sappaṭighā dhammā. anidassan’āppaṭighā dhammā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not blown off; not removed; not purified
Example1: taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnītakasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not worth treasuring; not worth recording; (comm) not worth keeping in the heart; lit. not having treasure quality
Meaning in native language: не стоящий хранения; не стоящий записи; (комм) не стоит хранить в сердце; досл. не имеющий качества сокровища
Construction:
na > a + ni + √dhā + na + vant
na + nidhāna + vant
Commentary: (MNa) anidhānavati vācan'ti hadayamañjūsāyaṃ nidhetuṃ ayuttaṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī, anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: blameless; irreproachable; unimpeachable; with clean hands
Example1:
datvā ca bhutvā ca yath'ānubhāvaṃ,
anindito saggam'upeti ṭhānan'ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not blamed; not criticized
Example1:
porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not removed; not drained off; not purified; lit. not lead away
Meaning in native language: не удаленный; не опустошенный; неочищенный; досл. не уведенный вовне
Example1: taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnīta-kasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not leading to extinguishment; not conducive to Nibbāna
Meaning in native language: не ведущий к затуханию; не способствующий Ниббане
Example1: so ca kho atta-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, para-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, ubhaya-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, paññā-nirodhiko vighāta-pakkhiko anibbānasaṃvattaniko

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not understanding; not penetrating; not finding; lit. not going deeply (into)
Meaning in native language: не понимающий; не проникающий; не находящий; досл. не углубляющийся (в)
Example2:
aneka-jātisaṃsāraṃ, sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakāraṃ gavesanto, dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not invited; not asked round
Commentary: (VIN 2.6.3) animantito nāma ajjatanāya vā svātanāya vā animantito, ghar'ūpacāraṃ okkamante nimanteti, eso animantito nāma.
Example1: yāni kho pana tāni sekkhasammatāni kulāni, yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpesu sekkhasammatesu kulesu, pubbe animantito agilāno

Meaning IN CONTEXT: sign-less; featureless; without attributes
Meaning in native language: без признака; без особенностей; без атрибутов
Example1:
yass’āsavā parikkhīṇā, āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca, vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ, padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.
Example2: yāvañ’c’idaṃ, bhikkhave, alam’eva animitto samādhi bhāvetuṃ. animitto, bhikkhave, samādhi bhāvito bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: uncertain; indefinite; not settled; lit. uncontrolled
Example1: ime kho pan'āyasmanto, dve aniyatā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
Example2: addhuvaṃ me jīvitaṃ, dhuvaṃ me maraṇaṃ, avassaṃ mayā maritabbaṃ, maraṇa-pariyosānaṃ me jīvitaṃ, jīvitaṃ me aniyataṃ ; maraṇaṃ me niyataṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not knowing the escape; not understanding the remedy
Meaning in native language: не знающий спасения; не понимающий как избавиться
Example1: tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ gadhitā mucchitā ajjhopannā anādīnavadassāvino anissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not leaning (on); not depending (on); being independent
Construction:
na > a + ni + √si > say + ya
an + nissāya
Example1:
na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbatenā'pi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: detached; disengaged; separated; independent
Example1: yāva’d’eva ñāṇa-mattāya paṭissati-mattāya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
Example2:
yass’āsavā parikkhīṇā, āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca, vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ, padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: fact of not being jealous; not being envious; lit. non-envy state
Meaning in native language: отсутствие зависти; отсутствие ревности; досл. состояние без зависти
Example1: paḷāsissa purisapuggalassa apaḷāso hoti parinibbānāya. issukissa purisapuggalassa anissukitā hoti parinibbānāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not returning; not turning back
Example1:
tassa me ahu ussāho, nibbānaṃ abhipassato.
“nā’haṃ bhabbo eta’r’ahi, kāmāni paṭisevituṃ.
anivatti bhavissāmi, brahmacariya-parāyaṇo”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without attaching; not clinging; without resting; lit. not settling down
Meaning in native language: не привязывающийся; не цепляющийся; не опирающийся (на); досл. не осевший
Example1:
kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā, nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena, jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not given up; not cast off; not removed
Meaning in native language: не убранный; не отброшенный; не удаленный
Example1: taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnītakasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: army; military unit; squadron; force
Meaning in native language: армия; воинская часть; эскадрилья; вооруженный отряд
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.50) anīkaṃ nāma hatth'ānīkaṃ, ass'ānīkaṃ, rath'ānīkaṃ, patt'ānīkaṃ. tayo hatthī pacchimaṃ hatth'ānīkaṃ, tayo assā pacchimaṃ ass'ānīkaṃ, tayo rathā pacchimaṃ rath'ānīkaṃ, cattāro purisā sarahatthā pattī pacchimaṃ patt'ānīkaṃ
Example1: dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā bal’aggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīka-dassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2:
akkosaṃ vadha-bandhañ'ca, aduṭṭho yo titikkhati,
khantībalaṃ bal'ānīkaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: army inspection; military review
Commentary: (KVa) anīkassa dassanaṃ anīkadassanaṃ.
Example1: dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā bal’aggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: untroubled; undisturbed; calm; lit. not trembling
Meaning in native language: не обеспокоенный; не потревоженный; досл. не дрожащий
Example1: “saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paro’parāni, yass’iñjitaṃ n’atthi kuhiñci loke. santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso, atāri so jātijaran’ti brūmī”ti
Example2: ahaṃ sukhito homi niddukkho homi avero homi abyāpajjho homi anīgho homi sukhī attānaṃ pariharāmi

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not obstructive; not hindering; not blocking
Meaning in native language: не препятствующий; не мешающий; не блокирующий
Example1: satt'ime, brāhmaṇa, bojjh'aṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimutti-phalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: cuts; slashes; slices; shears
Example1:
kuso yathā duggahito, hattham'eva-anukantati,
sāmaññaṃ dupparāmaṭṭhaṃ, nirayāy'upakaḍḍhati.
Example2:
kuso yathā duggahito, hattham’ev’ānukantati,
sāmaññaṃ dupparāmaṭṭhaṃ, nirayāy’upakaḍḍhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: compassionate (towards); kind (to)
Example2: yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit’esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: having compassion (for); taking pity (on); having concern (for); lit. with compassionate mind
Meaning in native language: имеющий сострадание (к); полный сострадания (о); заботящийся (о); досл. с сострадательным умом
Example2: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto’pi pacchimājanata-anukampamānasā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: out of compassion; lit. taking pity
Commentary: (SNa) anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti anukampaṃ cittena pariggahetvā, paṭiccā'ti'pi vuttaṃ hoti.
Example1: sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yen'āyasmā girimānando ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā”ti.
Example2: yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit’esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: compassion; pity; lit. trembling with
Example2: yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit’esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
Example3: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto’pi pacchimājanata-anukampa-mānasā

Meaning IN CONTEXT: compassionate; lit. shake together
Example1:
ekam’pi ce pāṇam’aduṭṭhacitto, mettāyati kusalī tena hoti.
sabbe ca pāṇe manas’ānukampī, pahūtam’ariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.
Example2: byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahit’ānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: imitates; does likewise
Example1:
duddadaṃ dadamānānaṃ, dukkaraṃ kamma kubbataṃ.
asanto n’ānukubbanti, sataṃ dhammo durannayo

Meaning IN CONTEXT: bridle; reins
Example1:
chetvā naddhiṃ varattañ'ca, sandānaṃ sah'anukkamaṃ,
ukkhittapalighaṃ buddhaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: to make progress; to proceed; to advance; lit. to go along
Meaning in native language: добиваться прогресса; продолжать; продвигаться; досл. идти вдоль
Commentary: (SNa) taṃ paṭipadaṃ bhāsitamattena vā savanamattena vā okkamituṃ paṭipajjituṃ na sakkā'ti attho.
Example1:
anukkamitave sakkā,
yāyaṃ paṭipadā daḷhā,
yāya dhīrā pamuccanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (vinaya) not suspended
Example1: yattakā bhikkhū tassa uposathakammassa patta-yuttā anurūpā, sabb’antimena paricchedena cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā, saṅghena anukkhittā, te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā ekasīmayaṃ ṭhitā.
Example2: yāvatikā ca bhikkhū kammappattā saṅgh'uposath'ārahā cattāro vā tato vā atirekā pakatattā pārājikaṃ anāpannā saṅghena vā anukkhittā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: minor; secondary; less important
Example1: “kiṃ pan'imehi khudd’ānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāva’d’eva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṃvattantī”ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: following; followed by; going after
Example2:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha, daḷhaṃ sikkhatha santiyā,
mā vo pamatte viññāya, maccurājā amohayittha vas’ānuge.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: permeated; pervaded; lit. gone into
Example1: s’āyaṃ nhānīyapiṇḍi sneh’ānugatā snehaparetā santarabāhirā, phuṭā snehena na ca paggharaṇī.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is greedy (for); wants; craves
Example1:
khettaṃ vatthuṃ hiraññaṃ vā, gav'assaṃ dāsaporisaṃ,
thiyo bandhū puthu kāme, yo naro anugijjhati.
Example2:
lābhakamyā na sikkhati, alābhe ca na kuppati,
aviruddho ca taṇhāya, rasesu na-anugijjhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: supports; maintains; upholds; fosters
Example1: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yath'eva mayā pubbe bhikkhusaṅgho anuggahito, evam'eva eta'r'ahi anuggaṇheyyaṃ bhikkhusaṅghan”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not risen up; not grown out of; not came out of
Meaning in native language: не поднявшийся из; не выросший из; не вышедший из
Example1: seyyathā’pi uppaliniyaṃ vā paduminiyaṃ vā puṇḍarīkiniyaṃ vā app’ekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṃvaḍḍhāni udak’ānuggatāni anto-nimugga-posīni,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: support; help; assistance; nurturing
Example1: cattāro’me āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhav’esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya : kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, mano-sañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ
Example2: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso piṇḍapātaṃ paṭisevāmi n’eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva’d’eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya vihiṃsūparatiyā brahmacariy’ānuggahāya

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not grasping; not embracing; not taking up
Meaning in native language: не хватая; не охватывая; не принимая
Construction:
na > an + ud + gaṇhā + ya
an + uggahāya
Example1:
idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
Example2:
sīlabbataṃ vā'pi pahāya sabbaṃ, kammañ'ca sāvajj'anavajjam'etaṃ,
suddhiṃ asuddhin'ti apatthayāno, virato care santim'anuggahāya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: helped (by); assisted (by); supported (by)
Example1: katihi pan'āvuso, aṅgehi anuggahitā sammādiṭṭhi cetovimuttiphalā ca hoti cetovimuttiphal'ānisaṃsā ca, paññāvimuttiphalā ca hoti paññāvimuttiphal'ānisaṃsā cā'ti?

Meaning IN CONTEXT: walking; walking up and down; going along; following (along) after
Meaning in native language: ходящий; идущий вперед и назад; следующий за
Example1: seyyathā’pi dve agārā sadvārā. tattha cakkhumā puriso majjhe ṭhito passeyya manusse gehaṃ pavisante’pi nikkhamante’pi, anucaṅkamante’pi anuvicarante’pi.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: walking; strolling along
Example1: atha kho māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agyāgāraṃ ten'upasaṅkami.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: permits; allows; grants permission
Example1: na jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ. yo paribhuñjeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa. anujānāmi tikoṭiparisuddhaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ — adiṭṭhaṃ assutaṃ aparisaṅkitan’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not making an effort; nor arousing oneself; lit. not standing up
Meaning in native language: не прилагающий усилий; не пробуждающий себя; досл. не встающий
Construction:
na > an + ud + ṭhaha + āna
an + uṭṭhahāna
Example1:
uṭṭhānakālamhi anuṭṭhahāno, yuvā balī ālasiyaṃ upeto,
saṃsannasaṅkappamano kusīto, paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: inaction; not getting up; not making an effort; (comm) lack of energy to do work; lit. not standing up
Meaning in native language: бездействие; не подъем; не приложение усилия; (комм.) недостаток энергии для выполнения работы; досл. не вставание
Commentary: (SNa) anuṭṭhānan'ti kammasamaye kammakaraṇavīriy'ābhāvo.
Example1:
asajjhāya-malā mantā, anuṭṭhāna-malā gharā,
malaṃ vaṇṇassa kosajjaṃ, pamādo rakkhato malaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: practised; established; lit. stood near
Meaning in native language: приобретенный на практике; установленный; досл. рядом с которым стоял
Example1: ’mettāya ceto-vimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādas’ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: he regrets; has remorse; lit. is burned with
Meaning in native language: раскаивается; сожалеет; испытывает угрызения совести; досл. сгорает (от)
Example1:
yo pubbe karaṇīyāni, pacchā so kātum’icchati.
sukhā so dhaṃsate ṭhānā, pacchā ca-m-anutappati.
Example2:
na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu, yaṃ katvā anutappati,
yassa assumukho rodaṃ, vipākaṃ paṭisevati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: highest; unsurpassed; unexcelled; superior; lit. nothing higher
Example1: sauttaraṃ vā cittaṃ ‘sauttaraṃ cittan’ti pajānāti, anuttaraṃ vā cittaṃ ‘anuttaraṃ cittan’ti pajānāti;
Example2:
varo vara’ññū vara’do var’āharo,
anuttaro dhamma-varaṃ adesayi.
Example3: iti’pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā'ti

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unexplained; unrevealed; obscured; lit. not made open
Meaning in native language: необъясненный; нераскрытый; непонятный; досл. не сделанный открытым
Example1: tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañ'c'eva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañ'ca uttānī karonti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: moaning (about); lamenting (over); sighing (about)
Example1:
acaritvā brahmacariyaṃ, aladdhā yobbane dhanaṃ,
senti cāp'ātikhīṇā'va, purāṇāni anutthunaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: moans; laments; grieves
Example1:
yam'assa vādaṃ parihīnam'āhu, apāhataṃ pañhavimaṃsakāse,
paridevati socati hīnavādo, upaccagā man'ti anutthunāti.
Example2:
tam'ūpanissāya jigucchitaṃ vā, athavā'pi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
uddhaṃsarā suddhim'anutthunanti, avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.
